boardgame.name: Men
Mn
boardgame.description:
Men (Egyptian: Mn) is a 5,000 year old game from ancient Egypt. It is roughly contemporaneous with Mehen and Senet. One of the most mysterious of ancient games, only two partial boards have been discovered by archaeologists, along with a detailed tomb painting depicting the board layout and playing pieces, and one sculpture depicting players playing it aboard a ship. Game scholar and designer Zach Horton recreated a speculative version of the game and it was released in two versions by Pandora Games: as a deluxe boxed Kickstarter set with Mehen and later as a standalone game. This modern reconstruction closely follows the ancient evidence and produces a unique game with a trading theme wherein players send ships out on trading missions and wager on when they will return, while manipulating them en route in an attempt to fulfill their own predictions and foils their opponents'.

The game utilizes a unique three-dimensional board, enabling playing pieces to be placed both flat on spaces and upright in grooves. This aspect has been re-created in the modern version utilizing a handmade wooden board.

On their turn, each player chooses on their turn from a number of different options, from gaining sticks to throw to obtaining movement banks that can be accumulated for later sprints, to sending a new ship off on its journey. No player “owns” any of the ships. Any player may move any combination of ships however they wish. Victory points are obtained by performing certain actions (setting sail, picking up goods, bringing goods home), as well as by correctly predicting how long a given ship will be at sea. Every time a ship sets sail, all players mark their prediction on a simple, but hidden, ledger. When a ship returns, predictions are checked against the actual results. Meanwhile, all players manipulate conditions on the board to try to make their own predictions come true!

Any number of ships can be sailed in a game, but only 5 can be on the board at any given time. Only 5 cargoes can be picked up and returned to port during the game. Once all have been picked up,
ships can continue to sail, but do not pick up any cargo on the Foreign Port space (though they must still pause there).
Once all 5 cargoes have been returned to Port, the game ends. After scoring that ship, the player with the most Victory Points wins.

boardgame.name: It's Simple, We Kill the Sandy Claws
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A Christmas-themed one-page dungeon written for four, level one peasants in Knave. However, this dungeon should be compatible with most old-school style games.

The hamlet of Ricabouth is ruled by Greta Fernsby, a 12-year-old girl with psychic powers and a bad temper. She is hosting a mandatory Christmas Eve party at the Fernsby manor house, during which she intends to capture Santa Claus and display him, alive, in a suspended cage until he dies of exposure. It is up to the PCs to stop her. Or join her. Or rob everybody. Anything goes.

boardgame.name: The Past's Grasp
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Past’s Grasp is an exploration adventure of the ruined body of a giant construct from a previous age. The goliath structure still crackles with electricity and the residents within have only grown weirder over time. Discover awakened antennae, dreams of lost loves, and maybe even the origins of constructs.

boardgame.name: Home Alone: Keep the Change
boardgame.description:
Spend your holidays outwitting bandits or dodging paint cans with Home Alone: Keep the Change! In the game, you split into two teams to relive the classic story — or to see whether this time the bandits can make off with the loot!

One player is Kevin, who draws from a deck of loot and trap cards, then places them around the house. The other players are Marv and Harry, who move through the house, flipping over cards and trying to find loot (like VCRs) and avoid traps (like slippery stairs). One player can also be "Old Man" Marley, who can help Kevin fight off the bandits!

The bandits must collect enough loot and escape before Kevin's mom gets home!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Court & The Conclave: The Last Battles of the Dawn War
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Before the multiverse, before the gods, before the concept of order itself: all was chaos. As order first began to emerge from chaos, a war was fought between the new gods and the primordial forces of chaos who opposed them: the Dawn War.

boardgame.name: Tasha's Crucible of Everything Else Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:


27 new subclasses for every class, including artificer
3 remastered subclasses; just like the Circle of Spores druid and Bladesinging wizard get reworks in Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything, the Way of the Four Elements monk, the Wild Magic sorcerer, and the Undying warlock get new, exciting reworks in Tasha’s Crucible of Everything Else
Over 30 new spells
Social, combat, and exploration spells for every tier of play
Harness the power of the planes with new conjunction spells!
Over 50 new magic items to be discovered in any environment
Useful for both players and dungeon masters!
Discover the arcane properties of Tasha's Cauldron
Alternative rules for Working Together
Add mechanical depth to characters by using Variant Flaws
Come to the dark side with Downtime Crime Revisited
Preludes, an alternative to traditional backgrounds where Dungeon Master and player work together to determine a character’s backstory and background feature

boardgame.name: Tasha's Crucible of Everything Else Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:


23 new subclasses for every class, including artificer
More optional class features
Adds spells from Xanathar's Guide to Everything to expanded spell lists
7 new character races, both custom and classic
Variant and subrace options for aarakocra, kobolds, and orcs
Use swarms to speed up group combat
Guidelines for how to make your own swarms
11 new swarm stat blocks
29 new NPCs ready to implement into any game
Meet Tasha, one of the greatest wizards of the known multiverse
Encounter a wide variety of criminals, druidic knights, priests, paladins, and sorcerers
37 new creatures for your party to encounter
Discover an imaginary goddess, a new familiar, and the world's weirdest dragon
Browse the library of quasi-elementals and
Face off against hoards of imaginative zombies
Never(?) get lost again with your new monstrous compass

boardgame.name: Old School Stylish
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Old School Stylish is a supplement for Old-School Essentials (OSE) that replaces its class system with one that focuses on what your characters do and find in the game world. Instead of picking a class from a list and following its ability progression, your characters will find dusty manuals in time-lost libraries, petition or rescue masters in hopes of learning their secrets, or even invent their own techniques.

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG Basic
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Micro Chapbook RPG system is an ultra-simple dark fantasy roleplaying game that is designed specifically for solo play. Take on the role of an adventurer, delving into dungeons, killing monsters, gathering gold, and becoming the hero of the town! These basic rules are the definitive rules for the system and are all you need to play any adventure for the system. They are considered the new 1.75 edition rules, but remain completely compatible with all the other game content in the system.

boardgame.name: The Book of the Fallen
boardgame.description:
Nephandic antagonists for Mage: The Ascension (20th Anniversary Edition)

Publisher's blurb:

This exploration of the Fallen, their Arts, and the ways in which they prey upon us includes:


Cults and Characters
A glance at real-life evils right next door
Metaplot Options and Roleplay on the Edge
New sects that dominate the new millennium
The Qlippoth and its influence upon the Fallen
Infernal Investments, malignant paradigms, Nephandic Arts, dark heresies, and more.

boardgame.name: Kisarta
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Kisarta, a setting of damned souls and otherworldly horrors for the 5th Edition of the world’s most famous RPG! You will stand before dangerous creatures straight from a nightmare, terrifying and forbidden knowledge, and ancient secrets which might lead you to insanity. But the true question is: what is Kisarta?

It is the Pale Sun that shines dim over each of the Dominions you will explore during your travels.

It is the centerpiece riddle, the key to everything.

It is the crux of the Great Game, that is to say, the complex plot weaved by the local gods.

It is a universe of its own, where life and death, purity and corruption, hope and despair bleed together in tangled and contradictory schemes, while hoping to give meaning to a dull and dying existence.

Exploring Kisarta means not only traveling through places full of dangers, but also walking in search of the meaning of your own existence, in the shadows of the strange and awesome powers of these lands which might be crucial to your success, or failure. Your weapons will be not only literal weapons and arcane spells, but also forgotten lore, pacts with unfathomable beings and your skill in navigating the intrigues of these dark corridors of powers.

The true rule is that there are no rules, only plans of distant deities, whose designs are alien to mortal minds.

So prepare yourselves and pray for your salvation, since in these lands you will find neither hope nor pity.

boardgame.name: Tales of Kisarta
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Many stories unfold and intertwine along the infinite paths through time that constitutes Kisarta. The star, pale in its brightness, illuminates the misfortunes disseminated in all the Dominions. Bright moments of distorted lives, which say a lot about what has been and what will be, appear to the attentive eye.

boardgame.name: The Lost Codex of Kisarta
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Lost Codex is a strange and ancient legend that many talk about, but that few have had the opportunity to browse for real. Comprised of sheets held together by a string of thorns and existing in a single copy, it is kept in a trunk buried in the sands of the Whispering Desert, and its pages contain secrets and knowledge of all kinds, often insane and disturbing. The few who have been able to leaf through it tell of having come across disturbing pages, in which they found descriptions of alien creatures, remedies for the decomposition of flesh and spirit, sheets upon sheets full of diseases that can be contracted with the touch, representations of incomprehensible, illegible and impossible to replicate languages , illustrations that change as you look at them, stories of expeditions that ended badly or started in total desperation.

boardgame.name: Nowhereville
boardgame.description:
A Game of Small Town Horror

From the back of the book:

Nowhereville is a horror-themed tabletop roleplaying game set in a town that won't let you leave. Terrible things happen in Nowhereville, perpetrated both by monstrous people and literal monsters. But the townsfolk constantly forget about these things. For some reason, you remember. And you ?ight back.

The game draws inspiration from the early works of Stephen King, the X-Files, and Twin Peaks.

In Nowhereville, you'll endeavor to stop terrible things, defeat monsters, save lives, and foil plots.

And maybe, just maybe, someday you'll get to leave.

boardgame.name: The Plague of the Pharaohs
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Some things should remain buried and forgotten by history.

When a team of explorers and Egyptologists take shelter in the Lost Pyramid of Renpet, they find out exactly why...

User summary:

The 25-page scenario is distributed with three 1-page print-and-play handouts.

boardgame.name: Neon Blood
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This game and setting explores a world of ultra-violent solutions between mega corporations with the power and resources of nation-states, actual governments, gangs, mercenaries, and citizens in a dystopian hellscape of over-sexualized, over-fetishized, over-medicated, under-educated, malnourished, quick-fix, lock me into a synthesized illusion, chop my limbs and make me better society. Come for the firefights, hacking, and criminal fun, stay for the rampant consumerism, authoritarian control of the populace, and what it means to LIVE. To be HUMAN.

Take on extremely dangerous, and often foolish, missions for money, reputation, and the thrill of striking back against the corporate overlords. In a world of guns, cybernetics, sinister machinations, and omnipresent hackers, survival is not always enough. Sometimes, taking the fight to the enemy is the only way to sleep at night.

boardgame.name: Tetrarchia: Playmat
boardgame.description: A 60 x 30 cm neoprene playmat for the Draco Ideas edition of the board game 'Tetrarchia', compatible with all modes of play.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Chalnath
boardgame.description:
Adherents of the Greater Good, the T'au Empire have expanded into the Vedik System, allying with the local planetary governors. Their efforts begin to unravel when an Adepta Sororitas ship arrives, and the Sisters of Battle attempt to wrest control of the system. Kill Team: Chalnath lets you take part in the guerilla battles fought between kill teams of the T'au Empire and Adepta Sororitas.

The new edition of Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team has been redesigned from the ground up as the greatest tabletop skirmish experience yet, and Kill Team: Chalnath is the perfect expansion. This incredible boxed set includes two full kill teams – trainee Adepta Sororitas Novitiates, who have yet to earn the right to wear power armour, and the high-tech special forces of the T'au Pathfinders – alongside the rules, terrain, and a new gameboard.

This boxed set includes:

1x 96-page Kill Team: Chalnath Rules Manual: Expand your sphere of operation with background for the Vedik System, plus the Adepta Sororitas and T'au Empire forces fighting within. Alongside this narrative, you'll find new rules, datacards, and background tables for both the Adepta Sororitas Novitiate and T'au Pathfinder Kill Teams, as well as a host of additional special rules and missions set in this war zone.

23x Citadel Miniatures: Two full kill teams comprised of an Adepta Sororitas Novitiate Squad and a T'au Pathfinder Squad. Each features a wide array of customisation and assembly options, allowing you to personalise your kill team, and many of the models can be assembled as multiple kinds of operatives. Both of the kill teams also come with a full transfer sheet, giving you a wide range of emblems for customising your models.

7x Terrain Pieces: Recreate the battle-scarred war zone with two large ruins and five damaged walls, representing the kind of terrain that kill team skirmishes are frequently fought across.

1x Double-sided Kill Team: Chalnath Gameboard: Engage in skirmishes on this double-sided cardboard gameboard that represents the blasted terrain of the Vedik System.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Warhammer 40K: Kill Team – Tac Ops Cards

listing.notes:
Kill Team Chalnath - Brand New (Did not come in shrinkwrap)
Free shipping

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Compendium
boardgame.description:
While many kill teams, such as those of the Deathwatch Space Marines, are made up of hand-picked, specially trained warriors, others are taken from the rank and file of the galaxy’s many armies. While these impromptu operatives are often given little more than a mission description and a firm pat on the back, the harsh conditions of a killzone quickly turn them into hardened veterans in their own right.

Kill Team: Compendium is the definitive 168-page resource for bringing 19 different factions into the world of tabletop skirmish combat, featuring almost every major faction from Warhammer 40,000. From daring Tempestus Scions to disciplined T’au Hunter Cadres, armies from across the galaxy can now put forward their best and brightest to undertake dangerous missions behind enemy lines.

Inside, you'll find:


Datacards, Ploys, and equipment for 19 factions ranging from Adeptus Astartes to Genestealer Cults
Details about fire teams, the small groups of operatives that make up a full-size kill team
A stunning collection of model photography and artwork featuring kill teams and their operatives


The full list of factions available in this book is as follows:
Space Marines
Grey Knights
Imperial Guard
Forge World
Ecclesiarchy
Talons of the Emperor
Traitor Space Marines
Death Guard
Thousand Sons
Chaos Daemons
Craftworld
Commorite
Troupe
Greenskins
Tomb Worlds
Hunter Cadre
Cadre Mercenaries
Hive Fleet
Brood Coven

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pantacle
boardgame.description:
Each player must gather enough resources (Influence (cubes), Adepts (meeples), Powers (tokens)) to light the flames of the PANTACLE one by one. These resources can only be obtained by requesting favors from the Keepers of the PANTACLE. There are 7 types of favors that provide either resources or powers whose effects will make your progress easier. Beware though! If another player has the right set of cards in hand, they can counter your request and bribe the favor away from you.

To light a flame on the PANTACLE, players regularly need to sacrifice accumulated resources. The further players progress, the harder the PANTACLE resists and the more complex the game becomes. Indeed, a player who lights a flame receives a reward (resource, power) but also a curse, despite the sacrifice of resources. The Keepers can suspend a Curse for a time, but will the other players let them?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Rumini: Hajónapló
boardgame.description:
Rumini - Hajónapló (The Logbook) is a quick and thrilling card game which brings to life the adventures of Rumini and his friends from the popular storybook series.
The game includes 32 scene cards, featuring some of the main characters from the book. But only 8 of these cards are used in each game; these are selected by the players using a secret drafting method, so nobody knows exactly which cards will be part of the set.

Players are dealt character cards of lower or higher value. Each round, a scene card is flipped over. Players can play a card to the corresponding scenes in which the specific character appears. But choosing the right moment is crucial because character cards become more valuable in the later rounds! The question is whether there will be another matching scene coming up later! Otherwise, players risk penalty points for cards remaining in their hand at the end of the game.

The winner will be the player with the highest score – ultimately the one who is most successful in playing the right cards at right moment.

In the year of its release, the game was awarded the Game of the Nation 2021 (Ország Játéka) joint professional prize in family & party category, as well as the JEM Board Game Award (JEM Társasjáték Díj) in national development category by most popular Hungarian board gaming magazine JEM.


Gyors és izgalmas kártyajáték, melyben Rumini és barátai kalandjai elevenednek meg. 32 jelenetkártyát tartalmaz a játék, ezek mindegyikén néhány Rumini karakter szerepel. Minden partiban 8 jelenetkártya kerül játékba, melyet a játékosok közösen, de egymás előtt titkosan választanak ki, így senki se tudhatja pontosan, milyen jelenetekre kell számítani.

A játékosok a karakterkártyákat tartanak a kezükben, alacsonyabb vagy magasabb pontszámmal. Ezeket a kártyákat kell a megfelelő jelenetekhez kijátszani – de nem mindegy, mikor! Mert ugyanaz a kártya a későbbi fordulókban egyre többet ér, de vajon lesz-e még olyan jelenet, amelyhez kijátszható? Ha nem, akkor a játék végén büntetőpont jár.

Az nyer, aki a lehető legjobb pillanatban veti be a megfelelő kártyákat, és ezzel a legmagasabb pontszámot éri el.

Megjelenésének évében máris kétszeres díjnyertes lett a Rumini - Hajónapló: családi- és partijáték kategóriában megosztva elhozta az Ország Játéka 2021-es szakmai díját, valamint a hazai fejlesztésű játékok között a JEM Társasjáték Díjat a népszerű magyar társasjátékos magazin szavazata alapján.

boardgame.name: Long Bear Valley
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Long Bear Valley is a Cascadian Fantasy Hex-Crawl for 3rd level adventurers. Begin in hex 1. Giant sword ferns, fallen cedars, and the ever-pounding rain limit travel to one hex per day; every step must be earned with a machete. The valley is encircled by cliff-faced mountains, except hex 1 which exits homeward to the south. The adventurers must return to hex 1 within three weeks to catch a convoy back home

boardgame.name: APJOK Lietuvą
boardgame.description:
The witty board game "Visit Lithuania while riding the horse" is a great party entertainment and an almanac of the strangest place names. The game will make you smile and cause surprise. Here it will become clear that Vilnius is in Kupiškis district, Klaipėda is a suburb of Panevėžys, and Lithuania has both Foreign and its own Colony. These are funny, witty and unexpected place names of Lithuania country, which can be found on closer examination of the map.

Saddle your horse and surround your estates as the Grand Duke of Lithuania - be it Meškuičiai, Zuikinė or Vištytis. And your horse will definitely enjoy visiting the Sheepskin, Cabbage or Horse Pastures.

On their turn, players move around the board with horse similar to a knight in chess. Player have cards in hand with places they must visit. The game ends when first player has visited all places in his hand and returns to start/finish position. Whoever finishes first is the winner.

The board game has 3 versions of the rules: the main "Play against opponents", a team game and the "Play against the system" game.

Šmaikštus stalo žaidimas „Apjok Lietuvą“ – puiki vakarėlio pramoga ir pačių keisčiausių vietovardžių almanachas. Žaidimas privers nusišypsoti ir sukels nuostabą. Čia paaiškės, kad Vilnius yra Kupiškio rajone, Klaipėda – Panevėžio priemiestis, o Lietuva turi ir Užsienį, ir savo Koloniją. Tai – juokingi, šmaikštūs ir netikėti mūsų šalies vietovardžiai, kuriuos galima rasti atidžiau tyrinėjant Lietuvos žemėlapį.

Balnokite žirgelį ir kaip Lietuvos didysis kunigaikštis apjokite savo valdas – ar tai būtų Meškuičiai, ar Zuikinė, ar Vištytis. O jūsų žirgui tikrai patiks apsilankyti Avižonyse, Kopūstuose ar Žirgų Ganyklose. Kas pirmas apjos, tas ir laimės.

boardgame.name: Terror Watch (Vol. 1 No 1 - Feb/Mar/Apr 1994)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Terror Watch was produced for at least two issues during 1994. It was intended as a quarterly. Subtitled "The Quarterly Paranormal News", issues featured a variety of horror gaming materials with a definitive focus on Lovecraftian elements.
boardgame.rpg: Bureau 13: Stalking the Night Fantastic (3rd-5th Editions)
Stalking the Night Fantastic (1st and 2nd Editions)
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Burdaerata
boardgame.description:
This party game it´s about Venezuelan Slang!

You decide a JUDGE player to draw a WHITE card with a VENEZUELAN situation, all players play a VINOTINTO CARD (with lot of obscene slangs) from his hand and shuffle all of them, the most hilarious one chosen by the Judge will be the winner of the round.

Played until a player gets 10 wins or when the group decide to end the game.

This game it´s the Venezuelan Ambassador of the Slang and colonialism from Venezuela (and that´s a high stake), played around the world by Venezuelans diaspora and anyone who love tropical caribbean spice!

You want to learn how to speak like a venezuelan? ¡COMPRA ESTA VAINA!

boardgame.name: Terror Watch (Vol. 1 No 4 - Nov/Dec 1994)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Terror Watch was produced for at least two issues during 1994. It was intended as a quarterly. Subtitled "The Quarterly Paranormal News", issues featured a variety of horror gaming materials with a definitive focus on Lovecraftian elements.
boardgame.rpg: Bureau 13: Stalking the Night Fantastic (3rd-5th Editions)
Stalking the Night Fantastic (1st and 2nd Editions)
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: The Lost Spells Card Game
boardgame.description:
The Lost Spells is a card game based on the stunning book by best-selling author Robert MacFarlane, and Illustrator of over 40 beloved classics, Jackie Morris.

As with its predecessor, The Lost Words Card Game, the game is won by pairing the Spell (poem) cards in your hands with the beautifully illustrated Nature cards before your opponent. However, the Spells in this game are only revealed when you collect the correct amount of key cards! Is your memory good enough to remember the whereabouts of your card and will it be stolen by your opponents Foxy card? The first player to collect 6 pairs of cards, wins!

listing.notes: Title: The Lost Spells Card Game Publisher: KOSMOS Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Shadow Mystics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spirits of Shadow!

The bright lights and big cities of the intergalactic society may bring fame and fortune, but the infinite shadowed corners of the universe hold power for those wise enough to perceive its secrets. Unveil nearly a dozen awesome new options for your character with the Shadow Visionary alternate class features and Speaker for the Ancestors mystic connection, tapping the power of the mysteries with fade into shadow, shared memories, umbral shift, and strength of the clan!

boardgame.name: Lesser Villains (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‐hearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‐cloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‐up including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat bloc and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

This instalment presents nine lesser villains—priests, thieves, fighters and wizards—to bedevil your low-level characters.

boardgame.name: Lesser Villains (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‐hearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‐cloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‐up including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat bloc and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

This instalment presents nine lesser villains—priests, thieves, fighters and wizards—to bedevil your low-level characters.

boardgame.name: Hidden Knowledge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abandoned for centuries, the tower of El-Arrin is reputed to house secrets and lost knowledge of an ancient empire. But almost no one who ventures there returns, and the few that have were quite mad. Myth makes the tower and its secrets older than the desert itself. Who knows what riches were left behind?

Hidden Knowledge can be used as an adventure in any campaign world, or played as a sandbox in Hellebarde's default setting. Written and tested with Castles and Crusades RPG, notes are provided for conversion to other OSR systems.

Hidden Knowledge can be used stand-alone or as part of the Exterris Adventure Tome AT-5 (AT-5 plus ONA-17 through ONA-20).

boardgame.name: Kaverno De Malbono
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something is turning miners at The Dig into hideous mutants! And it's up to a reluctant band of wasties captured by the same slavers and wasteland bandits that seized control of the worksite to confront it.

Kaverno De Malbano is an introductory adventure to the forthcoming Goblins & Gearshifts setting and the latest in the series of monthly One Shots from Atomic Ninja Studios.

boardgame.name: Sold My Soul For Rock And Roll
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, things are a little TOO easy for a band, and you have to wonder why. Six months ago, no one had heard of Desecrated Sanctum, but now it seems like they are everywhere. Frontman Colin Thornsley is doing all the late-night talk shows, the band is on their way to selling out arenas and their music is blazing up the metal charts.

When a mutilated body is found outside the band’s hotel, some begin to suspect there may be something sinister going on with Desecrated Sanctum. Now it’s up to you to see if there is any connection and discover what’s REALLY behind the band’s sudden, meteoric rise.

This adventure works best with a team of Seasoned investigators who have a reputation for handling matters discreetly, either independently or through some sort of agency.

Included with this adventure are three Fabled Environments floorplans each presented at 8 1/2" x 11" size without square or hex grid (Modern Floorplans: Hotel, Modern Floorplans: An Average Modern Jazz Club, and Modern Floorplans: An Average Small Auditorium).

boardgame.name: Machi Koro 2: Landmarks Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
This promo pack for Machi Koro 2 adds three new landmarks: the City Hall, Renovation Company, and Private Club. The new cards can simply be shuffled into the corresponding deck.

City Hall: "If you roll 1 die and receive no coins, get 2 coins from the bank. (all players)"
Renovation Company: "If you roll 6, get 1 coin from the bank for each [mug] establishment you own. (all players)"
Private Club: "Take 5 coins from each opponent who has 2 landmarks. (builder only)"

This promo pack was initially made available as a bonus for those who preordered the game.

boardgame.name: Preternatural Chrome
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Neon Blood supplement for Psionics, Sorcery and Mythical Creatures.

boardgame.name: Datacache [N] The Golem
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The attempt to extend human life by coupling the full cerebral download to an A2i controlled frame, affectionately referred to as "Golems".

boardgame.name: Killfile 1: Saturday Night Slaughter
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A common eVehicle NuWa shop. There are two aisles in the middle of the store and a bullet resistant eGlass wall to run the news, adverts, and to cover the clerk. There are four eCharge stations outside, one is occupied by a monocycle.

boardgame.name: Killfile: Shells and Ghosts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

How far would you go for your family? How far is too far? In this KillFile NanoPlot, these questions and more will be answered, one way or another. At the end of the day, family might be all we've got, but only the individual can define what family really is and what it is not.

Good luck Glitches.

boardgame.name: The Heist
boardgame.description: The Heist is a game about pulling off a robbery. It is meant to be a fun, fast game with lots of action. The Mastermind running the game must be ready to think on his/her feet and to heavily improvise.

boardgame.name: Store-Bought Is Fine
boardgame.description:
Store-Bought Is Fine is an RPG meant to be played while grocery shopping. It can be played with as many players as you wish but two to five seems best. Collectively, the players make up the coven.

You are witches. You were minding your own business, performing a divination spell in the middle ages for a peek into the future when oops! You overdid it on the eye of newt, and instead of getting a glimpse at the future, you’ve landed in the future. Unfortunately, you seem to have left some of your memories in the past. If only you could remember why you were trying to peer into the future in the first place.

You need to brew up three more spells to get back home, but unfortunately good apothecaries are hard to find in these strange times and you haven’t the time to grow the ingredients yourself. You’ll just have to see what foraging these strange “grocery stores” have to offer.

boardgame.name: Fab 4
Fab Four
boardgame.description:
It is the late 1960s. The world faces an existential threat of which it predominantly is unaware. Extradimensional beings are scouting the earth, planning for a massive colonization effort and other heavy downers. It will be a total bummer for humanity.

Recently, a tiny group of humans commenced transcendental meditation exercises, fueled by psychoactive drugs, free love, and chocolate. Through this advanced methodology of hanging loose, these few laid back humans have opened the third eye, blown their minds, and become aware of the invisible alien invasion. Only they can stop the global horror that looms just outside the consciousness of humanity. Unreal!

These few, these fab, these controversial heroes are all that stands between continued flower power and cosmic horror – John, Paul, George, and the Ringos. In the groove and dedicated to preserving the world as they know it, they seek to raise global consciousness by planting hidden knowledge in their popular music – and they take direct action against the shadowy forces of malevolent evil that threaten the very fabric of existence. Obviously, to keep on truckin’ takes dedication and much time. This is the real reason the Beatles have stopped touring. They are doing something far more important.
boardgame.rpghonor: 2021 RPG Geek 24 Hour RPG 1st Place Winner

boardgame.name: Chompin' Charlie
boardgame.description:
Roll the dice, then feed Charlie the matching colored acorn. Watch his eyelids – when they reach the top, he’s ready to pop! (the acorns will fall from inside the tree onto the table)

Grab the acorns that scatter from Charlie’s tree as fast as you can, and be the first to fill your secret stash (player card) to win!

boardgame.name: Beware of the Bear
boardgame.description:
Carefully open the door, and poke his belly to make sure he’s asleep. Did Papa stay snoozing? Whew – that was a close one! You can now take one of his goodies. But if you press your luck…Papa is going to wake up and jump out of the cave, and you’ll have to give away your goodies! If you can catch him with your ‘bear’ hands, your goodies are safe. The player with the most goodies wins the game!

Players roll a die and collect a goodie or poke the bear's belly, depending on the die roll. Play continues until the Bear's belly is poked and the release mechanism shoots the bear in the air. The player who catches the bear keeps all their goodies; the other players lose 1 goodie.

The game ends either when the bear jumps or the goodie basket is empty. The player with the most goodies wins.

This is the first and last issue of Udûn, a zine which carries my games in The Pocket Armenian when I'm unable to print them there.

boardgame.name: Echoes of Void
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Echoes of Void is a mystery adventure where players stumble into an urgent crisis. A building clings to the side of a cliff. The fissure below emits Unreality. Inside, Bellamy, the 7th and Last, has failed to defeat No-Thing who now threatens to unbind the nothingness. Can the players figure out what is happening and stop No-Thing before all is lost?

boardgame.name: Swamp Monster
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Your town is terrorized by a Swamp Monster who poisons all water supply. You and your companions band together to defeat the Monster and to finally rehydrate the population. However, when your team enters the cave that precedes the Swamp Monster, you learn that you must fight it’s minions before you can even reach it. Will your journey end in misery? Will it end in success? Or will it end in drama? The journey is yours to explore.

boardgame.name: HeroQuest: Hero Collection – Commander of the Guardian Knights
boardgame.description:
Prepare for battle! The Commander of the Guardian Knights has been summoned by Mentor to join the heroes in the fight against Zargon’s evil forces. As the head of an elite cadre of noble knights, the Commander’s first responsibility is to protect their fellow heroes from the dangers that lurk behind dungeon doors and can always be found in the thick of combat, leading the way with sword sharp and shield sturdy. The Guardian Knights are the King’s finest warriors and personal guard, devoted to protecting the realm at all cost. They are models of chivalry and honor, chosen to uphold the tenets and values of the kingdom all while pushing back against the armies of Dread.
- This HeroQuest character collection includes 2 finely-detailed miniatures and 12 game cards.
- With 3 unique powers and knight skills not possessed by any other HeroQuest character, this well-trained armored fighter is ready to stand between allies and danger, with sword and shield at the ready.
- Choose from 2 different sculpts of this Commander of the Guardian Knights hero
- Requires HeroQuest Game System to Play

During the construction process, you face new challenges each time. The dice roll determines which buildings players have to draw on their own sheet, and whoever scores the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Duel TCG
boardgame.description:
Duel Trading Card Game is a realtime online card game where players assume the role of a powerful mage, casting spells and abilities trying to reduce their opponents HP to 0 to win the duel. There are no creatures or items allowed in the Tournament of Gods, so player’s decks that they build consist entirely of spells and abilities. Duel is realtime, meaning there are no turns and both players receive 1 Mana every 5 seconds to use to draw cards and cast spells and abilities.

Cast a spell by spending the amount of Mana listed as a gold number in the top right of the card and set the projectile sideways on one of the Spell Timers in the center of the field. Set it facing your opponents, as if it was in the air on its way to hit them. Your opponent then has 10 seconds to hit that incoming attack with one of their own, (and if the one that they use is double the ATK or more of the one it collided with it not only kills the weaker one but also continues on towards the enemy’s HP.) or use a quick-play ability such as Blink or Reflect.

Players make decks of 50 cards that have no other restrictions whatsoever, just a 50 card max, but they do also have something called a Type Mastery, which is a single type (card color) that they can cast for 1 less Mana and take one less Damage from. There’s no limit to how many spells can be used against a single incoming attack, and there’s no limit on how many can be played per turn, or how many cards players can draw per turn either, the only limit is how much Mana you have.

boardgame.name: The Super Villain Handbook Deluxe Edition (SUPERS!)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

From publisher blurb:

IT'S BACK, AND BETTER THAN EVER!

The Deluxe Edition of the Super Villain Handbook gives you:

44 villainous archetypes, from the deadly Assassin to the Villain With All Your Powers.
48 fully developed antagonists, each with history, personality, and story hooks.
The Heroes of the YOUniverse, 8 champions of justice you can use as PCs or NPCs.
Support for 9 different forms of super villain gaming, like the World Without Heroes, Jailbreak, Evil Genius School, Heist Picture, and Revenge Squad.
Many of your favorite characters from the public domain, including the Black Terror, the Green Turtle, Stardust the Super-Wizard, Women in Red, Miss Fury, and more!

boardgame.name: Sin Again: Daeva
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Serpents are obsession defined. To know them is to want them, and to want them is to need them — but never as much as they’ll need you. Now, for the first time in over 13 years, bask again in the glorious blasphemies of Clan Daeva.

Sin Again is a complete guide to the Daeva in Vampire: The Requiem Second Edition, with updates and expansions to their original clan book, Kiss of the Succubus.

boardgame.name: Doodle Dungeon: Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
A promo pack for Doodle Dungeon consisting of 4 cards each of

• Lasso: At the beginning of the next turn: If you have played this lasso, you draw 1 of your hand cards and add them to your hand.

• Zäher Schleim,: Immediately get 1 slime monster, strength: +14, damage: 1. Ignore the distance rule. A hero on a space with slime will not move until the slime has been defeated.

• Schicksalswürfel: If the monster wins, the hero suffers double damage. If the hero wins, he gets back as many ♥ as the damage indicated for the monster. (No further dungeon action allowed.)


In destail:
• Lasso
Zu Beginn des nächsten Zugs: Wer dieses Lasso gespielt hat, zieht 1 deiner Handkarten und nimmt sie auf die Hand.• Zäher Schleim
Erhalte sofort 1 Schleim: Monster, Stärke: +14, Schaden: 1. Ignoriere die Abstandsregel. Ein Held auf einem Feld mit Schleim bewegt sich erst weiter, wenn der Schleim besiegt wurde.

• Schicksalswürfel
Vor dem Kampf spielen: Gewinnt das Monster, erleidet der Held doppelten Schaden. Gewinnt der Held, erhält er so viele ♥ zurück, wie beim Monster als Schaden angegeben ist. (Keine weitere Dungeonaktion erlaubt.)

boardgame.name: The Cold Moon Sabbath
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Once a year on the longest night, as the year draws to a close and days grow shorter and nights grow longer, cold sweeps up the town in a blanket of white, the witches in the area gather to celebrate this year’s Winter Solstice - A time for renewal, regeneration, and respite from some of the busiest parts of the year. You might think that the Winter Solstice is just another time to gather with loved ones and drink eggnog as we burn our finely decorated Yule logs, but when have holidays ever been easy?

Ringing in the new year means closing out the last one. The Winter Sabbath is the perfect meeting place of old rivalries and new love affairs, old traditions and new customs, and so very much drama that your fellow covenites will be talking about this year’s celebration until the next.

More so than most Winter Sabbaths, this year is buzzing with excitement as the Cold Moon falls on the solstice. It is the best time for stirring the pot, shaking things up, and forging ahead into new things. Will you be soaring into the new year on your broom, or will you be falling into it face first? Who is vying for power, magic or other? When is the caterer going to get here? And, most importantly... What could possibly go wrong? All this and more will be answered when you attend The Cold Moon Sabbath.

boardgame.name: The Dead Eye: Kickstarter 2020 promo cards
boardgame.description:
Set of three promotional cards from the 2020 Kickstarter campaign for The Dead Eye.

Kanyn - A narrow escape. + 2 distance

Rovr - Catch and release. Use BALL to discard heat.

Htcha - It's bait. - 2 distance

boardgame.name: The Village of the Grippli
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Focusing on a temperate rainforest and the grippli village within, Issue #4 of the Populated Hexes Monthly contains a carnivorous plant, a grippli village, two grippli race-as-class playable options, and some new nature-oriented spells.

boardgame.name: Lesser Villains (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‐hearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‐cloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‐up including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat bloc and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

This instalment presents nine lesser villains—priests, thieves, fighters and wizards—to bedevil your low-level characters.

boardgame.name: What Nightmares May Come
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

What Nightmares May Come is a suspense-noir tale that begins as a suspense horror and quickly transforms into a journey into the dreamscape where the boundary be- tween what is real and what is nightmare is meaning- less. Against the thematic backdrop of a demonic pos- session, the crew must uncover the true nature of the evil terrorizing the victims, ultimately come face to face with their own demons, and hopefully find the wisdom to help a hurt soul come to terms with their grief.

An aging catholic exorcist and assessor needs the crew's help in banishing the alleged evil spirits surrounding a young boy. What kind of terror could bring a once steadfast priest to the breaking point ? Could a mere child really be the harbinger of something evil or is something else at play? Whatever it is, it’s quickly spreading to the nearby neighbors who are being plagued by the all too real events colored by death and terror. If that wasn’t enough, people are starting to believe the rumors about a previously captured serial killer who is on the loose again. Will the crew be able to save the residents of the 36th Street Apartments in time before their own living nightmares consume them?

boardgame.name: Topic_
詞彙捕手中文達人版
詞彙捕手英文達人版
boardgame.description:
In the real-time party game Topic_, whoever ends up with the fewest cards in front of them at the end of the game wins.

To set up, shuffle the proper number of cards based on the player count, then place the deck face down in the middle of the table. Reveal one card so that everyone can see the themes depicted on this card, as well as the category and the number on the card on the top of the deck. The category indicates which theme to use this round. All players now compete to call out a word that fits the chosen theme that has as many syllables as the number showing on the deck. When all but one player has called out an appropriate word, the remaining player takes the card lying on the table, then a new round begins.

boardgame.name: Mistfall: Heart of the Mists Kickstarter Edition
boardgame.description:
This entry is for the Kickstarter edition with additional content in the box. Limited content consists of 54 cards.

The 54 Kickstarter Limited cards are: 32 regular enemy cards, 9 regular encounter card, 3 companion ally cards, and 10 reward cards.

The Limited cards have a text at the bottom saying: LIMITED. They are numbered 331 - 384.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists is is a fully cooperative card-based adventure game set in a world of mystery, eldritch powers and perilous adventures. Heart of the Mists continues the story of Mistfall in a standalone expansion featuring new Heroes, Enemies, Encounters and Quests, and introducing Allies, as well as alternative versions of some of the base game mechanisms.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a fixed deck of equipment and power cards, as well as a set of upgrades that can be added directly to a player’s hand during the game. A semi-randomly created board makes for a different landscape every time the game is played, and randomized sets of encounters and enemies create different challenges for players to face before their time runs out.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists introduces more of what made Mistfall great, making it a good entry point for new gamers, as well as a solid expansion for existing fans. With next to no elements replicated from the base set, Heart of the Mists is the perfect addition to the existing Mistfall set – and a challenging experience both solitaire, as well as with a group of up to three friends.

Gather up your resolve, check your gear and get ready to go to the smoldering heart of the unrelenting Mists!

listing.notes: NEVER PLAYED, WAS MY LATE HUSBANDS AND THERE IS A LOT OF STUFF HERE
includes: -Mistfall: Heart of the Mists Kickstarter Edition -Mistfall: Kickstarter Edition -Mistfall: Sand & Snow -Mistfall: Valskyrr – Campaign System

boardgame.name: Sechs-Sekunden-Kritzelei
Six Second Scribbles
boardgame.description:
Everyone plays at once in this fast-paced party game. Players have one minute to draw up to ten things from their category card. But not every doodle will do! To win points, other players must be able to guess what was drawn.

When the time is up, players pass around their drawings and try and guess what other players have drawn. If players guess a drawing right, then both the guesser and the artist score a point. After three rounds, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Arachnid
boardgame.description:
You are part of a colony of spiders, struggling to survive in a harsh “Bug eat Bug” world. Build your web, grow your colony and enhance your skills as you fight the elements and fend off attackers. The battles with invaders culminate with you eating your attackers after they are vanquished. Can you and your fellow spiders survive long enough to claim victory over several waves of invading insects?

Game Description

Arachnid is a cooperative game for 2-4 players. Each player is a spider, and starts out with a hand of action cards. This hand of cards will evolve over time as the player’s unique roll in the colony becomes more clear.
The play area is a hex grid, where players place tiles to show the web as it is spun. This shared web is the spider’s home, which they expand and reinforce to catch their prey. Bugs occasionally fly by, becoming trapped, and eventually, food. These Bugs are also used to acquire new skills, and breed more spiders to enhance the colony.
Players plan their strategy by laying out cards, face up, on an action track. This represents the possible actions the players might take. Players then choose which actions to take on a given turn by placing a token on the card of their choice, activating it. The chosen actions are resolved and the activated cards are removed from the track. The remaining cards are shifted downward and new cards are added to the beginning of the track. This action track is constantly shifting and the cards can gain more power or become less costly to use as they advance down the track. Players must anticipate events like bug attacks and storms, while deciding between leaving cards on the track to gain strength or using them to perform actions.
Each turn, a new event token is drawn from a bag. Events can range from bugs flying into the web, a storm, or an attack from a dangerous invader. Storms wipe out webs that aren’t properly reinforced, and clear off consumed bugs, so more can be captured. Storms also trigger replenishing of the event bag, which adds more powerful invaders to threaten the web.

How to win

The lifetime of a spider's web is limited and the source of food is constantly diminishing, until it is no longer possible for the colony to thrive. The spider colony must build the web quickly and efficiently, to better cope with the ever increasing threat of weather and invading bugs. The colony must build their web large enough to reach all six anchor points and survive the attacking critters. The victors are now ready to start all over, with a new web in a new location.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mannerism
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mannerism is a role playing game about becoming a mage and overthrowing the sorcerers who would keep you imprisoned to prevent you coming into your power.

It's about whether you decide to be open to others and play to your strengths, subjecting yourself to a tragic destiny or whether you will keep your true self hidden to surprise your enemies, but constantly overthink and never let anyone in.

Mannerism RPG uses a unique Approach based resolution mechanic so that there is no randomness or point spending whilst still being able to surprise everyone. Simply describe how your character acts while the GM imagines what failure looks like and resolve.

Characters advance in line with how they are played in this simple but deep game.

boardgame.name: Exhibition: 20th Century – Variation Showcases
boardgame.description:
Add 1 or more of these VARIATION SHOWCASES to the players' exhibition halls. Possibly on top of base game showcases, to replace those.

The 6 new showcases are:


Showcase ANTIQUITY (2 spots) for 5/4/3/2/1(0) victory points: Who has the oldest year in the right side spot?
Showcase UNIQUE DECADES (2 spots): Each decade must differ from the earlier placed decades of all players (including yourself) in this showcase. (With 4, 3 or 2 players, only the respectively middle 8, 6 or 4 decades are allowed. (So with 2 players only the 30s, 40s, 50s and 60s.)
Showcase SHORT ERA (3 spots) for 5/4/3/2/1(0) victory points: Who has the smallest difference in years between the left and the right side spot.
Showcase ONE DECADE (3 spots): All cards in this showcase must have the same decade.
Showcase SPREAD THE YEARS (4 spots): The difference between neighboring cards must be 20 years or more.
Showcase LINKS (4 spots): Each 2 neighboring cards must have OR the same continent OR maximum 5 years difference. (or both)


—description from the publisher

listing.notes:

Die 6 verschiedenen Vitrinen sind: - Vitrine ALTERTUM - Vitrine EINZIGARTIGE DEKADEN - Vitrine KURZE ÄRA - Vitrine EINE DEKADE - Vitrine VERTEILTE JAHRE - Vitrine VERKNÜPFUNGEN
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, NL
Title: Exhibition: 20th Century – Variation Showcases Publisher: Cwali Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Pocket Aquarium
boardgame.description:
Can you create the most harmonious aquarium?

Each fish in the tank has its own action. On each turn you can either flip a fish card so that it swims (and its action goes) in the opposite direction - or you can perform its action to move fish and various features around the aquarium.

Playing the 'feed the fish' card gives you a once-per-game special action, while a cat moves around the fish tank, acting as both a hindrance and a game timer.

At the end of the game, if you have all of the aquarium’s features in the right place, and score enough points by getting fish of the same species swimming happily together, you win!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Takers
boardgame.description: As the corporations consumed the government and lorded over this burned out husk of a world, some few communities kept hope alive, defying this brave new world to band together in order to survive. The leaders of these ragtag communities had one goal - band together enough people with the skills and will to care for the rest, and take whatever they could in order to survive. In a rigged system, they play by their own rules. Some say this makes them criminals, but those that depend on them call them … Takers.

boardgame.name: TriATri
boardgame.description:
TriATri is a must-follow trick-taking game in which the players each aim to score the most points.

The "lead suit" is determined by the color of gem chosen by the lead player, from either in front of themselves or a central pool. The winner of the trick will take the gem. Players earn positive points for complete sets of gems (1 of each color), and will typically lose points for incomplete sets.

The cards have a relationship such that their value may be multiplied depending upon the color of the previously played card.

boardgame.name: Taverns, Inns, & Taprooms in Hell
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Even the scorched battlefields of the war-torn layers of the Nine Hells need places travelers, devils, and hapless doomed mortals can kick up their feet, have a pint of ale (or larvae ichor, no judgment), and mingle with those willing to sell their souls and the fiends willing to take them.

boardgame.name: GPH2: Coral Basilica of the Water Genies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wherein our adventurers seek out the Emerald of Aquatic Perfection reputed to be held within an undersea palace. A dungeon for four to seven high-level characters. Drop in to any high level campaign. OSR-compatible.

boardgame.name: For Treats! For Glory!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

LIVE THAT KITTY LIFE!

For Treats! For Glory! is a one page tabletop RPG about living that cat life. Avoid Boredom. Seek a balance of Calm and Stimulation. Do what you want to do and have cool kitty experiences.

RUNS ON MOTIF

Simple d6 mechanic based on the Motif Framework. It answers both world questions and action resolution.

Create your kitty. Seek out the pleasures of being a kitty. Roll the dice to make things interesting and be surprised.

Your grand quest is to get that satisfaction. Your cosmic goal is to be content. The only great plotline here is living that cat life!

boardgame.name: 50¢ Fiends: Killer Clown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Killer Clown is the second in a series of fantasy/horror creatures designed for use with Savage Worlds Adventure Edition. You get a new creature with full game statistics, along with a few adventure seed ideas for putting this fantastic fiend to work in your game.

Killer Clown includes:

Killer Clown creature descriptions and statistics (2 versions)
Adventure Seeds
Funhouse Nightmare
Cosmic Clowns from Deep Space
Vampire Carnival

boardgame.name: Marché Beauvau
boardgame.description:
The finest restaurants in France know that on Saturday is when you find the finest goods in the Beauvau. And not all those stalls have enough goods to fill the demand, so you will have to run between the booths to find the best deals and products for your most refined dishes.

Marché Beauvau is a board game where you will have to show your skills to choose the better products for your restaurant menu in the market.

In the game, you will have a board with different stalls from the market, and these stalls will offer you other options. You will be using your resources to bid for the best products for your restaurant. Each player will have the opportunity to buy the receipts to use these products, but beware that there will be negative points if you don't fulfil some.

The winner will be the one that hits the 3rd Michelin Star, becoming the more distinguished chef in France.

boardgame.name: Battling Pirates
boardgame.description:
An competitive action target-shooting game in which two pirate or buccaneer players shoot marbles from their cannons in order to “sink” their opponent’s two ships in the middle of the game board.

When struck just the right way, the plastic pirate ship aligns up with the slot in the board, causing them to drop in and "sink".

The player who sinks both of the opponent's ships first, wins.

boardgame.name: Natural Philosopher
Wild West Archetypes: Natural Philosopher
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Savage Worlds RPG release brings you the Natural Philosopher Old West Archetype. This ready-to-go character build provides a basis for developing a character out to explore the natural world (and perhaps how it intersects with the otherworldly), even when doing so is dangerous.

Includes statistics for both regular and master versions of a natural philosopher's field kit.

Each Old West Archetype delivers the basic build, plus ideas for some typical roles the character may fill, variations you may want to explore, how it may suit races other than the default presented, and more.

boardgame.name: Super Action Role-Play
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super Action Role-Play (SAR) features comic book action with Bronze Age stylings! Make heroes or villains using a points-free system that minimizes number-crunching. The game’s versatile mechanics use a rugged 3D6-based action system that gives the gamemaster and players more control when the moment is at its most dramatic. Born from two previous editions of the 3D6 Supers RPG rules, SAR features area-based movement and easy “mook” mechanics that will have your characters mowing through nameless hordes and looking super-cool while doing it! Play using maps and miniatures, or employ theater of the mind, narrative style storytelling.

SAR also features a thematic caper generator for villain-based games, secret base design rules, a complete sample adventure, a skirmish plugin for player vs. player action, and solo rules to run exciting games all on your own! All you need to play are four six-sided dice and a handful of tokens or counters. Start your super adventures today with SAR!

boardgame.name: Dinamine
boardgame.description:
Become a jewel hunter and mine building master! In the basement of your castle is the entrance of an old mine. Dig into the depth of the earth in search for gems. The deeper you go, the more valuable these will be.

Dinamine is a mine building strategy game for 2-4 players. The goal is to build the most valuable mine in 10 rounds. Players must build tunnels and mine veins. The deeper the veins, the more valuable the gems that are mined from them.

On each turn, a player will build one or more tunnels in their mine by obtaining tunnel tiles that add up to the number of points obtained from round token + dice roll. The tiles chosen must be of equal or lesser value, as long as the number of points acquired does not exceed the value of the tunnel tile(s). In some cases, players can perform an extra action depending on the tile type.

The game ends when the last round token is played. (There are 10 rounds) The victory point (VP) count is then performed to determine who is the winner. The player with the most victory points (VP) after counting veins, altars, wells, rewards, items and missions is the winner!

boardgame.name: Firepit
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Firepit is a gladiator game where 1 or 2 players can battle in an arena.

boardgame.name: Heli Rescue
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Heli Rescue is a 2D game where the player flight a helicopter trying to rescue people.

boardgame.name: Super Stock Car
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Super Stock Car is a racing game seen from above.

boardgame.name: RAIN
boardgame.description:
RAIN is a solo game about auditory hallucinations. The games comes as an A3 sheet of paper, with the rules and a diagram to help understand the board printed on the rear. Players are expected to provide any other required components.

The board has different tracks for the volume of the protagonist's hallucinations, the current time, and the time you expect the hallucinations to subside.

The player will use a die to determine if the current volume of rain is enough to drown out the hallucinations. If it is, the player will be able to advance the current time on the tracks. If it is not, the player is instructed to wait a period of time equal to the distance between the current time and the time they were trying to move on that track.

The time tracks are in 8 different units, such as seconds, minutes, hours, days, and weeks.

The rules include an exception for the game ending in case the remaining period of the game would exceed your expected lifetime.

boardgame.name: Battle for Sularia: Blood, Profit, and Glory – K.Y.Z.R. "Omega Experiment" play mat
boardgame.description: A playmat designed for the Battle for Sularia: Blood, Profit, and Glory expansion of Battle for Sularia.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Battle for Sularia: Blood, Profit, and Glory

boardgame.name: Studies in Sorcery: Playmat
boardgame.description:
This neoprene playmat for Studies in Sorcery comes with stitched edges.

"It's not necessary for gameplay, but it does help with setup and look super nice!"

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Atlas
boardgame.description:
Players draw and play cards Action cards, such as deploying souls or tech, executing actions, or adding energy cards to play, enable abilities or attack.

Players win by lowering the opponent players base life from 40 to 0.
• In the case of both players reaching 0 Base Life Points simultaneously, then the game is considered to be a Draw.

boardgame.name: Jr. Rangerland Moth and Butterfly Blitz
boardgame.description:
Description from the publisher: Roll the die and be the first to complete a butterfly or a moth. Watch out because your opponents can swipe your cards, but so can you. Each card includes fun butterfly facts.

In this card turning, set collecting game, a roll of the die determines the action you can take.

2014 Creative Child Magazine Preferred Choice Award

boardgame.name: Unintended Magics
boardgame.description:
"The wizard Rammesu disappeared five years ago. Now his tower is acting up. Explore Rammesu’s Tower and save the village from its Unintended Magics. A free, light-hearted, adventure scenario for 4-6 characters, levels 5-7. A collaboration of six content creators
7 New Creatures
5 New Items
4 Detailed Maps
23 page PDF"

(Authors Summary)

boardgame.name: Video Shop Algorithm
boardgame.description:
Imagine if there was an algorithm that WASN’T dumb…What if there was an algorithm that didn’t deliver what it thought you’d like, but what you didn’t even know you wanted? In short, an algorithm that harnessed the chaotic discovery of a Video Shop, where chance encounters and unanticipated juxtapositions on the shelf led to new associations and experiences?

Sadly, there is no algorithm that can do that. But now, there is a game that can.

Video Shop Algorithm revives the “cognitive congeniality” of the video library, where objects and people in space combine to create fresh connections and new knowledge about film and video – ever the currencies of contemporary culture.

Working together as a team, you are rewarded for the number and complexity of connections you can draw between an ever-expanding mind map of film titles. Without access to your smartphone, you must draw deep on your memory and stored knowledge, as well as build upon that of your fellow team mates to tease out unexpected connections and ford unbridgeable divides.

boardgame.name: Capybara 'n' Capybara
boardgame.description:
Capybaras love to eat pumpkins. You’ll need the help of the baby monkey walking above to pick up the pumpkins that the capybaras like to eat. You, the players, play as capybara bosses, aiming to line up your capybaras well to earn lots of pumpkins!

In Capybara, you will form a line of capybaras to score Pumpkin cards. You will move the baby monkey above the row of capybaras to carry out different actions. You gain Capybara cards by moving the baby monkey forward to the left, gaining capybaras for the number of spaces moved.

You can also score Pumpkin cards by forming a row of capybaras that meet the Pumpkin scoring conditions, moving the monkey to the left to score them.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ユグドラサス (Yggdrasus)
boardgame.description:
In Yggdrasus, each player becomes a nation and engages in a three-year battle against the Kaiju: Yggdrasus. Use your nation's unique abilities, strategies, and international commitments to achieve victory.

The first step is to send your army around the world and complete local missions. In this way, you can raise the level of your army, or build facilities and secure supplies to grow your nation. Increasing your charisma and gaining the support of international public opinion will bring you many benefits.

There are many ways to earn VP, but the best way to earn a lot of VP is to attack and defeat the Kaiju itself, or to accept and feed refugees.

The game ends after 12 turns, and the nation that has earned the most VP is the winner.

boardgame.name: Corrosion: Metal Gears
boardgame.description: Metal Gears to replace the cardboard ones that come in the base game.

boardgame.name: Battle of the Bulge: Bastogne
boardgame.description:
In-Game Instructions

This historical computerized wargame covers the 12 long days of the battle for Bastogne from 12/16/44 - 12/27/44. Each turn represents approximately 12 hours. You are the commander of the Allied forces; your opponent is the computer which has control of the movement and attacks of the German combat units.

Note: You control the advance/retreat of both the Allied and the German units . . .

How well you command your forces is represented by the score shown on the screen. Each town (*) on the map is worth 1 point. On 12/26/44 AM your score is 49, which means you control 49 towns out of a possible 57. Each time a combat unit enters a town the score is recomputed and updated at the end of each turn . . .

There are two maps, a north map and a south map. Parts of the maps overlap.

boardgame.name: Osusowakeru Meido in Wario
Share With Others: Made in Wario
Warioware: Get It Together!
おすそわける メイド イン ワリオ
boardgame.description:
Get It Together! continues the WarioWare series tradition of tasking players with completing sets of "microgames", which each require the player to clear an objective in just a few seconds. In this game, Wario and his friends have been sucked inside his latest gaming device, meaning they must participate in the microgames themselves.

Source: Wikipedia, "WarioWare: Get It Together!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Kitty Cat Clash!: House Broken Expansion
boardgame.description:
Adoption fees have been paid and new cats (and a pig!) are entering your home for more mayhem and fun. Choose between three all new characters to add to your game, team up using new Team cards, or increase your game's challenge with new Stress cards.


New Playable Characters
New Team Cards
New Stress Cards


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Metal Kombat
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Beat the waves of evil robots trying to beat up your robots on five stages.

boardgame.name: Factory Funner: Precision Reservoirs
boardgame.description: Deal these reservoirs, instead of those from the base game, equal, or handicap skilled players.

FACTORY FUNNER (& BIGGER) PRECISION RESERVOIRS

boardgame.name: Robothlon
boardgame.description:
Dice management board game for 2 to 5 players.

In Robothlon you will have to guide your Robot to conquer the highest number of medals by participating in different Competitions, installing new Upgrades and selecting your Targets.

Modify the results obtained by making your Robot's skills interact with the values of the dice and use the Programs to solve the most complicated situations.

boardgame.name: Enciclopedia
Encyclopedia
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Encyclopedia! The year is 1739, and as aspiring naturalists and adventurers, you’ve been hired by the Comte de Buffon - Darwin's predecessor - to help him create the first encyclopedia of natural history. To do so, you’ll be conducting research, organizing ambitious expeditions and publishing studies of the world’s most fascinating creatures!

Encyclopedia is a dice-based worker placement game. At the beginning of each round, you’ll be drawing and rolling dice, then placing them on your player board. These dice can then be used to perform an action each turn, depending on their color and value. Your action can be preparing your expeditions by going to the Embassy, visiting the Bank to raise funds, or hiring your research team at the University. Once you’re ready to go, you’ll choose the Animal cards you wish to study, then organize expeditions to observe them in their natural habitats. When your research is complete, you’ll then be able to publish your findings in an attempt to become the biggest contributor to Buffon’s Encyclopedia. Every publication you make will earn you Victory points, and at the end of the game, you’ll score points based on collections of Animals and research amassed during play. The naturalist with the most points wins!

Encyclopedia was designed by Olivier Melison and Eric Dubus, the authors of Dominations: Road to Civilization and Museum. This expert worker placement game brings some fascinating new twists to the genre, offering multiple paths to victory. The game also offers a multitude of ways to counter the random element of your dice rolls. As well as being able to spend different tokens to change the value or color of a die, players have more than just their own dice to choose from, as other players dice can also be used! Taking a die from another player’s board does not cost anything, but the targeted player gains a bonus.

The game’s beautiful theme - with gorgeously illustrated animal cards - ties in strongly with its mechanics, making the rules easy to grasp so that you can jump straight in to devising the perfect strategy.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Republic of Virtue
boardgame.description:
This was the 2021 Hollandays Sale freebie game. Two players assume the role of French politicians trying to keep their heads during the Reign of Terror

The game consists of 27 cards with a combination of suit (hearts, diamonds or spades), rank (2, 3 or 4) and sphere (Military, Politics, Mob and Wild).

4 cards exist in a market accessible to both players, cards bought from this are replaced as they are bought.

On their turn, a play either: Buys a card from the display, Plays a card from their hand to their Tableau or Use a card in their Tableau.

3 Crisis cards are shuffled into the deck, when these are bought from the market certain cards in player tableaus are purged and players score points. If either player scores 21 points they win, if that doesn't happen before the third crisis, both players are swept up in the Thermidorian Reaction and are sent to the guillotine

The 6 DOUBLE LANDSCAPE park tiles don't bring victory points themselves, but contain 2 landscape types to connect to each adjacent tile.


This makes it even possible to cross landscape type areas, to fulfill the demands of your animals better.

The 6 goal tiles add variety to the YEARLY GOALS. It brings you more victory points if you beat your opponents by:
Getting a good variation in animal types.
Meeting other rangers in the market.
Pleasing your visitors with watchtowers, routes and views.
Creating the most mysterious secret spot.
Building spots where animals/visitors can move in each direction.
Being close to a market corner.



—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Nusfjord: InMyBox insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with board game Nusfjord, Nusfjord: The Forgotten, Nusfjord: Plaice Deck & Nusfjord: Salmon Deck expansions by Uwe Rosenberg.

boardgame.name: Roll to the Top!: Duel
boardgame.description:
In this 2-player variant of Roll to the Top!, the players start at opposite sides.
Instead of playing turns simultaneous, one player fills in first (the player who didn't roll the dice) and the other second.
Goal of the game is to fill the most spaces.

The sheet has 2 sides:

BATTLEFIELD: Move crisscross through the landscape to your opponent.
NAVAL BATTLE: Attack your opponent straight forward.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Rise of Hastur
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Slowly the harbingers of the Unspeakable One rise to infect humanity with despair: An impossibly huge stone tower surrounded by still, black water appears in Utah. Three seemingly-unrelated oil spills shift and transform into massive ritual circles, poisoning animals and humans alike. People across the globe succumb to deathly dreams and sleepwalk into the nearest ocean or lake. Four giant supernatural falcons manifest around the world and spread incomprehensible destruction.

In the end, Cassilda the blue flame of the Hyades battles the Unspeakable One in an effort to save the planet from Hastur’s all-consuming mantle of darkness. But the world is shattered and swallowed. You are one of the final survivors who escape - by traveling through time.

Now you stand on the brink of the Apocalypse, with one goal: Beat back the oily waters of the Unspeakable One and save the world from the alien pull of the Black Star.

boardgame.name: Strike The Sandwich
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are various methods to resolve attack rolls in Old School Revival systems. This presents an alternative system that can be used with B/X, Old School Essentials, or any compatible product.

boardgame.name: Brewkessel: School of Spellcraft and Sorcery #1 (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Once upon a time, there was a wonderful school of spellcraft and sorcery called Brewkessel. 62 years ago it vanished in a flash of red lightning, taking with it some of the best and brightest names in magic. All that was left behind was a deep, smoking hole. Was it the result of a spell gone wrong? Had the gods finally rained down judgement on their vile witchcraft? No one could say for sure. In fear of repeating Brewkessel’s unknown mistake, one by one the other schools locked their doors. Brewkessel reappeared 7 months ago.
boardgame.rpgseries: Brewkessel: School of Spellcraft and Sorcery

boardgame.name: Torinopoli
boardgame.description: A Monopoly-like game based on a ironic reinterpretation of Turin.

boardgame.name: War of Civilizations
boardgame.description:
Welcome to earth 2050. Climate change has melted the polar ice caps much faster than expected. Most of the earth is now underwater with continents shrinking to the size of islands. Helium-rich water is now found on earth because of global warming and increased pressure in the atmosphere such as on other planets. A new energy source called the Ocean Crystal has been discovered in helium-rich waters. Wars have been fought for this energy-dense resource that powers everything. Trees have adapted and absorbed aluminum from the earth’s crust to survive the wildly unpredictable climate and aluminum wood are much in demand to build war machines.

You have heard of the Island of Myth which is mentioned in legends as containing enough resources to last forever. Your ambition is to find and conquer the Island of Myth and crush your rivals once and for all.

In their turn, players move ships and collect resources from locations around the map with the aim of conquering the island of Myth.

After the first player conquers the island of Myth, there will be 3 more turns. The winner is the clan holding the Island of
Myth token at the end of the 3rd turn. If no one is left on the Island of Myth, then whoever owns the most islands across the globe wins.

KICKSTARTER LINK:
https://kickstarter.bluencore.com/warofcivilizations/

WEB LINK:
https://bluencore.com/bluencore-studio/
