boardgame.name: Archives of the Empire, Volume II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just North of Altdorf, not far from the village of Frederheim, the cult of Shallya maintains za Hospice. Behind its imposing walls, troubled souls receive succour, and a lucky few find respite.

One of its denizens, the ‘Lady’ Isabella, worries her carers. Her quill is ceaseless, though few can say what she writes. Despite the best efforts of the hospice staff, strange missives continue to appear in her room. Could there be some truth to her claim that she is collating a truly wondrous collection of writings?

Surely it can not be the case that she is who she claims to be — one Princess Isabella von Holswig-Schleistein, sister to Emperor Karl-Franz I. Some are beginning to wonder…

Welcome to Archives of the Empire: Volume II. A fascinating and diverse collection of articles on topics that cover the length and breath of the Old World. This second volume focuses on those towering walls of muscle and fat, the Ogres, who hail from the Mountains of Mourn but make their home across the Empire and indeed the world. Volume II details new locations, careers, and NPCs perfect for inclusion in your next WFRP adventure.

Archives of the Empire II includes:

Ogres of the Empire: Two chapters dedicated to Ogres, their place in the Empire, and their place at the gaming table. Included are three new careers, including the fearsome Ogre Butcher, who wields the magic of the Great Maw with bloody intent.
Star Signs and Astrology: Some say their fate is written in the stars, while others find their future in the gutter. This chapter provides a description of the star signs that dot the heavens of the Old World, along with the meaning that people invest in them.
Magical Items: Though magic items are rare in the Old World, they are coveted and powerful things. This chapter provides rules for generating magic weapons, armour, and stranger devices.
The Great Hospice: A retreat from the perils of the world, the Great Hospice provides a refuge for those who need it — and can afford it. Just north of Altdorf, the Hospice is a detailed location with maps, NPCs, plot hooks, and more.
Theatre of War: Though combat is a common feature of WFRP games, open warfare is rarely explored. This chapter provides rules for creating a cinematic battle in which competent Characters can influence the outcome.


Archives of the Empire II provides another varied collection of excellent and entertaining expansions to any gaming table. Packed with lore, NPCs, and exciting adventure hooks, this collection will kickstart your next adventure in Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay!

boardgame.name: Hero Hockey
boardgame.description:
Hero Hockey is a dexterity game that you play underneath the board.Move a magnet under the table to maneuver your "hero". Defend your goal and shoot toward your opponent's goal in this mashup of air hockey and foosball.

Each player controls one defender. The magnetic connection created between your steering magnet and the hero pawn brings the characters to life and lets you take direct control of your hero. Defend your goal and employ ball control, skill shots, and precision accuracy to get the ball into the opponent’s goal.

The first player to 6 points wins!

boardgame.name: Bamboo
boardgame.description:
For generations, bamboo has provided sustenance for your family, and cultivating it has helped you build the house you call home. The recipe for happiness is a good relationship with the temples, the neighbors, and the spirits that inhabit the reed bed.

In Bamboo you take the role of families that cultivate bamboo and use the fruits of your labor to take care of your family. In order to do that, players will manage the actions (bamboo tokens) available in their personal board and place them in the main board to gather Happyness points. Depending on how they place these actions. new actions for future turns will become available for them.

The possible actions they can take are:

Receiving money.
Collecting food to feed the family at the end of every round.
Improving their home by buying improvement tiles from the main board and placing them in their personal board.
Obtaining or executing balance tiles. These tiles will award points to the players depending on how they placed their improvement tiles.


The game ends after four rounds, and the player who managed to get the highest Happyness Points score will win the game.

Bamboo is a game of action management and tile optimization that is accessible to many, but with profound depth. This game is set in the same universe as Silk and Bitoku.

boardgame.name: Walkie Talkie
boardgame.description:
Get rid of your cards as quickly as possible to obtain the most points. Over and out!

Walkie Talkie is a co-operative game in which players have a very limited amount of time — 30 seconds per player — to get rid of all the cards in their hand, and the more cards that you play, the higher your score.

Everybody has a hand of six cards; cards have a letter on one side and a color on another, and you have to hold your cards however they're dealt to you. Place one card from the deck letter side up and another color side up. When the timer starts, everybody plays at the same time. You can play a letter on the letter pile as long as you can name something that starts with that letter and that "matches" the current color showing; similarly, you can play a color on the color pile as long as you can name something of that color that starts with the letter atop the letter pile. For example, when playing a "B" card next to a yellow card, you could say "Banana!", and when playing an orange card next to an "L", you could say "Lion!" You can't repeat a word previously given, and you can't name the color of the color card.

Whenever you want, you can say "Roger!", and all players must flip the cards in their hand, so letters become colors and vice versa. Alternatively, you can say "Over!", and players pass their cards to the left.

When time runs out, you gain points equal to the number of stars on played letter cards, then subtract 1 point for each unplayed card. Try to score as many points as you can!

boardgame.name: Fantastic Graves
boardgame.description:
Around you, night applies its cool shroud to the world; below, you apply your shovel. The lantern beside you shudders as mounds of dirt cast past your shoulder - the grave will be ready soon. But will the corpse still be? It's always a gamble being a gravedigger in a world of dark magics and monsters...

Often people consider adventuring to be the most dangerous occupation, but in reality there’s one more perilous still – the gravedigger. Digging burial plots and keeping the tombstones clean is hardly the limit to your duties when you have to guard crypts against ghouls, return vampires to their coffins, lift death curses, and explore the occasional unmarked catacomb for lost treasures. In Fantastic Graves, players take on the role of the much uncelebrated gravedigger, and GMs guide them through tales that may send them to their grave!

boardgame.name: Wild Spaces
boardgame.description:
In this game, the players portray characters who are descended from the ancient guardians of the lands and trees; they share characteristics of people and of plants.

Their goal is to protect the Wild Spaces that remain in the world. They are not human enough to do this as political operatives, although some may feed information to humans who are sympathetic to the cause. For the most part, the Flora, as they call themselves, are creatures of action. They work directly in wild spaces to protect them from developers, men, and even other forces which might change them.

The lore of the Flora says that if too many of the wild spaces are destroyed, it will bring an end to all life on Earth as it is currently known. They believe that Gaia, which is what they call Earth, will survive but change just as it did when the dinosaurs became extinct. This will also likely mean the extinction of the Flora, though they believe a new form of Flora will protect Next Gaia.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: JoJo Siwa
boardgame.description:
Put on your high tops and your biggest bow to get ready for the brightest, most exciting Monopoly game ever! Join the party with a worldwide superstar as sweets, sparkles, and of course hair bows beam from the tabletop with Monopoly: JoJo Siwa.

Believe in yourself with a version of the classic game that's as playful and positive as the role model herself! The fun doesn't stop as you buy, sell, and trade locations named for all of JoJo's favorite hair bows, such as the colorful Unicorn Horn, super fancy Pink and Gold Pearl, or the starred and striped All-American Girl!

Move just like the Dance Moms performer with every turn using six custom tokens for all the tour essentials: choose the Cupcake to feel like a kid in a candy store, follow your D.R.E.A.M. with the Unicorn or Rainbow, strut the board with the High-Top Shoe, take BowBow for a walk, or grab the Microphone to shout it out wherever you are!

boardgame.name: Etherfields: Harpy Campaign expansion
boardgame.description: The Harpy Campaign adds 30+ hours of game play and exploration aand the Harpy miniature.

listing.notes:
Etherfields Stretch Goals: Harpy & She-Wolf Campaigns + Etherfields 2.0 improved rulebook and optional game supplements
New in shrink
2nd wave release. Harpy and She Wolf expansions and includes improved rule book and optional game supplements.

boardgame.name: Yammer
boardgame.description:
Yammer is a game where you make words from letter cards in your hand and on the table to score the most points possible. The deck has 108 cards: 51 red letters, 51 orange letters, 2 wild cards, 2 2x multiplier cards, and 2 3x multiplier cards. It has rules for four games:

Yammer: Make a new word from cards in the hand and/or the well, scoring the sum of the letter values, doubled if they are all the same color, and times any multiplier cards played. Cards from the deck are used to replenish the well first, and then the hand. The highest score when the deck runs out wins.

Yammer Solitaire: Yammer for one player, aiming to have a high score at the end, or the fewest cards unused.

Yammy: Gin Rummy with the Yammer deck. Wild cards and multipliers are removed. Players start with 9-card hands, and on their turn they draw from the top of the draw or discard pile, and then discard a card. The round ends when one player can use their whole hand to spell words, each of which must be of the same color. Play until winning a target number of rounds or reaching a target total score.

500 Yammy: 500 Rummy with the Yammer deck. Like Yammy, except that players may play single-color words during their turn, and/or add to existing words on the table. They may also draw any card in the discard pile, but they must use that card to make a word immediately, and must draw all cards above that card in the pile. A round ends when one person depletes their hand. Play until reaching a target total score.

boardgame.name: Tenarlian: The Dying of the Light
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The longest night is here again! The dwarves of the Long Winter Vale are keeping their fires burning bright to drive back the darkness. They pass around plates of bread and drink spirits reserved for this night. Come the dawn, they’ll celebrate the coming of the new year. Unfortunately, in the midst of their celebration, the lights begin to go out…

In Tenarlian: The Dying of the Light, you attempt to survive in an adventure where torches are more powerful than magic. Evil things have come to the valley. Can you escape the encroaching darkness in this survival horror holiday adventure for 5E?

boardgame.name: The Meditant (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the help of meditation, breathing exercises, and visualization, meditants develop a sixth sense, gaining the ability to process sensory data — both tangible and intangible stimuli — to push their minds and bodies beyond normal limits. Meditants blend a unique combination of intuitive ability with intellectual study of maths and sciences to accomplish their goals. Meditants are healers, academics, and artists — they identify and release areas of blockage in the body, restoring health and balance, apply the laws of science and mathematics to achieve stunning feats of athleticism, and as they perfect their inward journey of self discovery, they master the art of becoming one with their weapon in combat, executing a choreographed series of thrusts and parries to claim victory on the battlefield.

boardgame.name: Sucesos Argentinos: Encuentro Nacional de Juegos de Mesa promo pack
boardgame.description:
Promo cards for Sucesos Argentinos about Argentinian board gaming events, adding more events for your timeline.


Edición de El Estanciero
Celebración del Día de la Niñez
Creación de la Tecnicatura en Recreación
Fundación de Asociación Civil La Cantera
Encuentro Nacional de Juegos de Mesa
10mo Encuentro Nacional de Juegos de Mesa
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 1 – Gobiernos y Conflictos
Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 2 – Economía y Sociedad
Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 3 – Ciencia y Cultura

boardgame.name: Keep the Heroes Out!: The Great Dreamer Expansion
boardgame.description: This crowdfunding exclusive expansion adds Cthulhu as a playable monster clan. Cthulhu can never be killed. When attacked, it lies down for a nap and gains the ability to mind-control any heroes on the dungeon.

boardgame.name: Keep the Heroes Out!: Guild Master's Revenge Expansion
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds a 1 VS many game mode: 1 player becomes the Guild Master and plays against the other players!

According to designer, the 1 vs many mode can go until 5-6 players vs 1 Guild Master(Max player count : 7).

boardgame.name: Heroes of the Pulp Age
boardgame.description:
Will you be the first to set foot in Atlantis for thousands of years? Can you find and capture a live Yeti? Where is the hidden tomb of Alexander the Great? Only the most daring of pulp heroes can survive these adventures!

From 2-6 adventurers will play as pulp-era heroes and race from continent to continent, over oceans and seas, attempting to find priceless artifacts and mysterious locales - all in the name of fortune and glory!

Each turn, players will head towards a rumored artifact (card) on the map board, then have to deal with the Perils that protect it. Dodge deadly traps, defeat vicious guardians and overcome impossible obstacles using your stats of Brains, Brawn and Deftness with a simple d6 roll.

But don't go it alone; recruit stalwart partners and bring along useful equipment to augment your own heroic abilities. First hero to achieve 100 Glory points wins!
Will you become a legendary adventurer or a simple footnote in history?

boardgame.name: Lords of Ragnarok: Monster Variety Pack
boardgame.description:
This extra Monster variety pack brings 4 new Monsters to the game. The monsters here can be used interchangably with the monsters from the core box.

Contents:
- Garm model with monster and artifact card
- Mare model with monster and artifact card
- Nokken model with monster and artifact card
- Nidhoggr model with monster and artifact card

-description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
This updated version of the popular WAR OF THE RING™ Card Box features new character art, with a great portrait of Gandalf the Grey and the symbol of the Free Peoples.

For dedicated gamers who need to keep their WAR OF THE RING SECOND EDITION and its expansions cards in perfect shape, this accessory is the perfect solution to store and protect them. Included in this set are:

The sleeves are also compatible with the cards included in the War of the Ring™ Collector’s Edition and in the Lords of Middle-earth™ expansion.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: War of the Ring: Second Edition

boardgame.name: The Assassins Four
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Murder is not uncommon in Dunwall, and politically motivated assassinations are rife. The player characters are asked by a member of the Bottle Street Gang, who would be falsely framed for these murders, to track down and kill four assassins before they can claim their target.

boardgame.name: Battlezoo Bestiary (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Inside the Battlezoo Bestiary, discover a treasure trove of over 100 brand-new monsters and villains for your players to confront and overcome at your next game! The creatures in this epic tome represent the best and beastliest submissions from the 2020 RPG Superstar contest, including monstrosities like the sailor-snatching muted delver, the spore-sowing fungal raptor, and the mind-melting orb of insanity.

The Battlezoo Bestiary also includes the new Monster Parts system—perfect for monster slayers who want to turn all those freshly collected ardeodaemon horns and parrotbear feathers into custom items and equipment. Completely compatible with Pathfinder Second Edition and full of rich inspiration for any fantasy game system, this book is a one-of-a-kind compendium useful for Game Masters and players alike.

boardgame.name: A.C.: After Collapse
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A.C.: AFTER COLLAPSE is a role-playing game (RPG) that is set or staged in a postapocalyptic future.
...
Modern society had reached the point where most people wanted for little. Their wishes could be made real with the push of a button. Many diseases had been conquered. However, humanity's reliance on technology set the stage for its eventual descent into chaos.

boardgame.name: Not Another Fetch Quest!!!
boardgame.description:
Not Another Fetch Quest!!! is a fast and fun party card game with a fantasy theme that pokes fun at one of the most annoyingly unnecessary elements in the RPG realm: fetch questing. Take the role of one of the Kingdom of Renfaire's most mundane of heroes and use your wits to conquer the quests before your rivals do.

Each player is represented by a character, which have unique stats and special abilities. Players take turns adding quest cards (with difficulty values that correspond to player stats) to the notice board until a player is challenged. When a player is challenged, they see if their stats (and loot, if needed) can overcome the challenges of the quests.

A player can win in one of two ways: if they win three challenges and get three success tokens, or if the player is the last one standing when all other players fail three challenges. It's suggested to play to two wins/losses if in a group of five or more. Also check out the other play modes for faster or more devious play styles.

boardgame.name: Battle Skies: Sheep Raid
boardgame.description:
Shepherds have led several flocks into a nearby valley to graze and breed. They had hoped to keep the whole thing a secret. Last night dragons were seen in the area and everyone knows they've come for the sheep and there is little anyone can do to stop them.

The Sheep Raid scenario turns the common strategies of Battle Skies on their head. Flying high and fast won't help you collect any sheep. Now you have to fly low to grab them and balance your need for speed with your ability to snatch sheep off the ground. This time the battle isn't to the last dragon standing but to the last sheep found and the winner is the one who has the most sheep at the end.

Sheep Raid is a scenario for Battle Skies, in which the players are dragons attempting to collect the most sheep. But beware, the shepherds have created decoy sheep filled with explosives, glue bombs, and other dangerous traps!

Contents:
1 folio cover
2 pages of sheep tokens (60 tokens total), consisting of:
16x seven-point sheep
10x ten-point sheep
8x Trap
6x Home Space
5x Net Bomb
5x Explosion
5x Dye Bomb
5x Glue Bomb
2 pages of scoring tokens (20x "2 points", 20x "-4 points")
1 scenario booklet

boardgame.name: Battle Skies: Dwarven Dive
boardgame.description:
A scenario for Battle Skies.

A recent earthquake near the heart of the dwarven kingdoms opened up a path down into one of their deepest treasuries. Vaults filled with gold, gems, and other valuables, a great many of which were stolen from the dragons they had driven out of the cave centuries before. Legends have it that the dragon who lived in the cave fought to defend it until the bitter end. It is said that in those last minutes he withdrew into himself and all that was left of him was a glowing crystal egg that has become known as a soul gem. Perhaps out of some strange sense of dragon pride or out of personal greed you have decided to make the dangerous run through the caverns in hopes of grabbing the soul gem.

Dwarven Dive is an intense race through a series of defended caves. The maps and defenses are set out as the game progresses to make for a different game each and every time it is played. Which dragon will be the first to make it to the vault and retrieve the fabled soul gem?

Contents:
1 folio cover
15 map sheets
Two counter sheets with 60 total counters, consisting of:
20x Dwarven Troops
15x Dwarven Priest
10x Recharging
15x Field Artillery
1 Scenario Booklet

boardgame.name: Battle Skies: Mantiran the Manticore
boardgame.description:
A special release character for Battle Skies.

From the back cover: "Mantiran is a majestic manticore who flits through the skies and has unique abilities in Battle Skies combat."

Contents:
1 folio cover
2 character sheets (1 young, 1 adult)
4 sheets of box minis, tokens and templates

boardgame.name: Battle Skies: Corianth Dragon
boardgame.description:
A special release character for Battle Skies.

From the rules booklet: "Corianths are dragons who are skipping through time and have unique abilities in Battle Skies combat."

Contents:
1 player aid
6 character sheets (2 "small", 2 "medium", 2 "large")
2 sheets of box minis, tokens and templates
1 rules booklet

boardgame.name: Catan: Sternenfahrer – Begegnungskarten für Sternenfahrer: Erster Kontakt
boardgame.description:
The trip goes on! The Galactic Council is looking for brave star travelers to explore the secrets of space. Are you ready to take the orders? Where will the flights take you?

Three new encounter cards on the themes of Room Amoeba, Hog Kham and Lost People, in which new contacts are made to previously unknown room inhabitants. Each card consists of several yes/no questions which lead to a specific result.

listing.notes: Brand new, still in shrink-wrap. Smoke-free home.

boardgame.name: Whispering City
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Set in the 1930s, Whispering City is a noir heist game. You and your table play as a group of thieves who just found out about a new job in town. Form your team, plan your heist, and escape with the riches. But be careful one among you may not be who they seem. Choose from one of 6 classes and plan out your heist. As you execute your heist, be careful of those that might betray your team!

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Through the Dark Portal Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
Through the Dark Portal is the second set of the World of Warcraft Trading Card Game.

A storm rages in the Blasted Lands as evil stirs within the Dark Portal. Bloodshed in Azeroth intensifies as the Blood Elves and Draenei join the frey. Already, the great conflict spills over into the other world... the Burning Legion looks on and plots its next move. Grab your weapons and make ready, the darkness is upon us!

As the name suggests, this set is set after the reopening of the dark portal. As such, many new Draenei heroes and allies are found amongst the Alliance, and new Blood elf heroes and allies are found amongst the Horde. Quests and items from Outland are also first featured in this set. However, there is no strict focus on the Burning Crusade-era, and the vast majority of allies, quests and items are still from Azeroth.

319 Numbered Cards: 120 Commons, 103 Uncommons Including 18 Heroes, 80 Rares, 16 Epics
3 Loot Cards
18 Oversized Heroes

boardgame.name: ラミネートラミー (Laminate Rummy)
Pastiche: The Birth of a Masterpiece
boardgame.description:
Pastiche: The Birth of a Masterpiece — first released as ラミネートラミー (Laminate Rummy) — is a rummy card game in which players need to publish dissertations, then have their work peer-reviewed in order to score...although sometimes the peer will be yourself!

In the deck of 49 cards, the cards are in seven suits with one suit going from 1-7, the next 2-8, and so on up to the final suit of 7-13. The game also includes dissertation cards that show various combinations of cards: numerical straights of length 5, 7, 9, and 11; three pairs; four pairs; three- or five-of-a-kind; and so on, with multiple copies of some dissertations. Players are dealt 3-5 cards based on player order, with everyone then discarding down to three cards in hand.

On a turn, take one of three possible actions:

• Research: Either draw two cards, add one to your hand, then discard the other; or add the top card of the discard pile to your hand.
• Present a dissertation: Take cards from your hand that satisfy the requirements of a dissertation, then place those cards on display in front of you, placing the dissertation on top. You can claim a specific dissertation at most once.
• Conduct a peer review: Select a published dissertation (from any player) that has two or more cards underneath it, then add one of the cards to your hand. If a dissertation has only one card underneath it, the paper has been accepted and (1) it is now worth points for its author and (2) it can be cited by future dissertations.

How do you cite an accepted dissertation? You present a new dissertation and pretend that the card under the accepted dissertation is one of the cards that you played; you can cite multiple cards in a dissertation, but you must play at least one card from your hand. For example, you can play two pairs of cards from your hand, say 3s and 8s, then "cite" a 6 from one of your accepted dissertations and a different 6 from another player's dissertation. You'd then claim the "three pairs" dissertation and place only the 3s and 8s underneath it. When you cite another player's dissertation, you must give them a card from your hand — ideally something useless! — as a thank you for their previous work.

Accepted dissertations are worth 1-9 points, and when a player has 15+ points, the end of the game is signaled. If this player has any cards in hand, they claim the "end flag" dissertation that's worth 1 point, then place one card from their hand underneath it. (If they have no cards, the game end is still triggered; they just miss out on the bonus point.) Continue play until each other player has completed two turns and the person who triggered the ending has completed one turn. The player with the most points from accepted dissertations wins; in the event of a tie, the tied player with the fewest accepted dissertations wins.

boardgame.name: Luftkampfspiel
boardgame.description:
The game is played by two parties with 3 planes each. The planes start at two opposite airfields, fly a circuit and return to their base. Movement is determined by a die. The course has several branches, where the players may choose with course to follow. If a plane gets on a space occupied by an enemy plane, the later is shot down and eliminated from the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The party who gets the most planes back to their airfield wins the game.

The Game was published before 1919, when the company still was named "Gebrüder Bing AG".

This is an introductory-level wargame. The game rules are simple and easy to learn. It is very suitable for beginners.

boardgame.name: Law and Disorder
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Law and Disorder is the first expansion book for After the War exploring legal and criminal aspects of the setting. In this book, we explore the tumultuous first years on Polvo after Songfall. We provide a robust system for creating your own settlement charters including the forms of government, community values, and how the laws are enforced.

This product also provides a series of useful tools for a gamemaster including a quick criminal scheme generator, and an optional system for resolving dramatic trial scenes during play. We round things off by establishing the new “Outlaw” profession category for player characters so that you can play bandits, tech-hawkers, vice-dealers, muscle, or even musicians!

And of course, what use would these rules be without a handy den of scum and villainy! That’s why we provide you with the vast “Mount Urashtu Complex” including a space-elevator and a colossal shanty city at the mountain’s foot.

boardgame.name: Crime Tours: Akte Hexagon
boardgame.description:
The HEXAGON FILE, your new case, requires concentrated and precise investigation work. Puzzling traces and suspicious testimonials lead you to several places in Europe, where you need to solve six mysterious criminal cases, such as bomb attacks, diamond and painting robberies, gambling fraud, bloody fashion shows and even murder on the famous Orient Express.

Crime Tours - Hexagon Files is a game for fans of crime games and escape room games who want to solve complex criminal cases with real locations. The players have to find out 10 details per case: Who was the perpetrator? What was his motive? What tools did he use? And what exactly happened? However, before the cases can be solved, the players have to follow the perpetrators from one city to the next. In order to find out where and when the perpetrators will appear next, the players must carefully analyze the 50 case cards and solve puzzles. If the players need help, they can use clue cards. At the end of a case, the players take the solution card to check how many details they have correctly determined. They get one point for each correct detail. Finally, the evaluation of the investigative work takes place based on the total number of points achieved.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Danger in the Deep
Gefahr aus der Tiefe
boardgame.description:
The year is 19XX. As the country's most successful secret agent, [NAME REDACTED], you've been on the hunt for an enemy spy, codename PROTEUS, on board the docked nuclear submarine Retiarius. However, your mission spirals out of control when the Retiarius submerges and its warheads prime for launch!

Danger in the Deep is a collaborative escape room game, where players must navigate their way through the engine room, crew’s quarters, mess and control room of a submarine. Only by gathering key information and solving the 14 interactive puzzles will teams be able to disable the warheads, stop PROTEUS, and save the world. The game features puzzle books, cards, secret components, a blueprint, and a working UV torch (batteries included, 3 x AAA).

Danger in the Deep features a tiered hint system, to enable teams of all abilities to progress through the game and story. The game can optionally be completed solo.

Danger in the Deep is designed as a one-time experience, as some of the puzzles require players to cut, fold and write on the components. However, Professor Puzzle do provide a printable pdf of the destructible components, in the Files section on BGG and on their website, to enable the game to be replayed.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 6 Spieler Spieldauer: 120 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 14+
Gefahr aus der Tiefe - Escape-Spiel Bereit für ein spannendes Escape-Spiel mit Tiefgang? Gefahr aus der Tiefe bringt abenteuerlichen Escape-Spaß in die eigenen vier Wände! Hier ist jede Menge Köpfchen, Teamgeist und schnelles Denken gefragt, denn nur gemeinsam kann die Mission Weltrettung erfolgreich abgeschlossen werden. Knifflige Rätsel, spannende Aufgaben, versteckte Hinweise und geheime Informationen, die sich nur mit der beiliegenden UV-LED-Lampe finden lassen, sorgen für jede Menge aufregenden Spielspaß für fortgeschrittene Escape Game-Fans.
Der gefährliche Agent Proteus bedroht die Welt – und das von einem U-Boot aus. Als Spezialteam haben sich die Spieler*innen mit an Bord der Retiarius geschlichen, um Proteus aufhalten zu können. Plötzlich taucht das U-Boot ab und die Spieler*innen sind gefangen! Unter Wasser! Nun heißt es unter Zeitdruck alle Rätsel zu lösen, jedem Hinweis nachzugehen und die Welt vor dem Untergang zu bewahren.
So wird’s gespielt: - In jedem Abschnitt des U-Boots wartenknifflige Rätsel und mysteriöse Hinweise auf die Spieler*innen. - Nach und nach muss sich das Spezialteam durch den Maschinenraum, das Mannschaftsdeck und die Zentrale der Retiarius knobeln und mit Hilfe der verschiedensten Materialien wie dem U-Boot-Bauplan, der UV-LED-Taschenlampe oder der Rotfolie auf dem Cover geheime Informationen finden. - Erst wenn die Spieler*innen das letzte Rätsel gelöst haben, können sie die Welt retten und Proteus schnappen.
Inhalt: - 1 UV-LED-Taschenlampe - 1 U-Boot-Bauplan - 3 Handbücher - 1 Box mit geheimem Material - 1 geheimnisvoller Umschlag - Spielanleitung
+ großer Escape-Spaß für zu Hause + mit UV-LED-Taschenlampe + für Fortgeschrittene + Spiel nur einmal spielbar
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Foundlings
boardgame.description:
In the drowned forest sits the ruins of the City. Before the hunger of our forbears poisoned the world we called it home. For generations it was a source of salvage. But maybe, just maybe, it holds the clues we need to fix this broken world...

Foundlings is a post-apocalyptic fantasy game about anthropomorphic survivors living on the edge of the ruins of their once great civilisation. It is about learning from the past in order to find some hope for the future. Foundlings uses a D10 based dice system, in which players roll all the dice. Results are not binary success and failure: a Foundling may succeed with an Edge, or with a Hitch...

From the Kickstarter page.

boardgame.name: Safety Ranger Game
boardgame.description:
Safety Ranger Game is designed to allow children 9 – 12 years old to learn about unsafe situations and the behavior of suspicious persons who are dangerous in daily life through the Monster. Children will take the role of a Safety Ranger (a hero who can use child power, knowledge, wisdom and courage) With assistant from people around them to defeat these Monster.

The game is creatively designed with a way of playing that encourages children to think, plan and not focus on competition each other. But children need 100% cooperative to defeat the Monster. It encourages children to use what they have to create unity in cooperation and see opportunities is the people around them and turn that people into great helpers in daily life.

Players pick a card and get the resource shown on the card, planning action behind the scenes, 3...2....1. Players open the player scenes at the same time, see the result, defeat the monster or the monster still rampant in the next round..

The players will play for 5 Rounds to challenge their teamwork to gain victory points after defeating the monster for each round and accumulate the highest score in order to write the names in the Hall of Fame.

Game Developed by Facebook Page “Learning From Board Game” (Board game designers for learning in Thailand) Partner with Awakening Creative and funded in research and design by Partage through CPCR (The Center for the Protection of Children’s Foundation) in Thailand. Thai Edition for Universal Children’s Day.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: The Center for the Protection of Children's Rights Foundation

boardgame.name: Out of Order
boardgame.description:
Trivia game where players have to give the correct answer to the previous question rather than the one they are currently being asked

Score is kept on the score track printed on the box. The first player to get to the end of the score track, wins.

boardgame.name: Awaken: The Liborian Saga
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

These are hard, trying times.
You can feel the tension in the air, nobody feels safe anymore. War is stirring up once again
on the continent. The last couple of years have been tough on the Alliance of the Great Cities. The loss of trust and faith between folk, the rise of corruption among the Vasalli,
and the Vargan incursions have all taken a toll.

The Liborian Saga includes:
- Extended Regional Lore — Players and Narrators can expect to get a ton of new information about the Great Cities of the region: Jorgun, Rinean, and Liboria, and their domains. This includes detailed maps, histories, locations of interest, and
story hooks.

- More Antagonists & Monsters — A fan favorite! We’ve got you covered with expanded options for antagonists, as well as new bigger and badder creatures who can be found in certain places or all over the continent. From the heart of the mountains to the depths of the seas, the monsters are here!

- Regional Orders — Although they share the same philosophy, the same Orders can differ from city to city. Additionally, every city and region contains smaller cults which are usually radically opposed to the establishment.

- Superior Gifts, Rituals, & Expanded Rules — Tightly connected to the regional Orders, Gifts are evolving constantly. A flying dagger can be handy, but it isn’t nearly as good as a flying dagger that’s on fire!

- Expanded Items and Weaponry — Salvora is a vast continent that’s filled with people from all walks of life, so it’s only natural that players should have access to a more varied selection of items and weapons to use throughout their
adventures.

- “The Death Cycle” — A spree of brutal murders has struck Liboria. Numerous bodies have washed ashore, each covered in similar marks. It seems like the victims were killed in the same way. Is this the work of one serial murderer? Or are more sinister forces involved? This large adventure will take you through the three Great Cities of the region and showcase much of the information presented in
the book

boardgame.name: Tomb of Immolation (5E/OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tomb of Immolation is a short but dense dungeon crawl with a variety of puzzles, traps, and role playing challenges to keep the players busy.


Designed for a party of five 5th level characters
The party should have a character with the ability to turn undead
The party should have a character with good disable device and lockpicking skills
Five new 5e and seven new OSR monsters described in the Bestiary
Three adventure hooks
Numerous new magic items described
Printer friendly maps and a set of five pre-generated player characters in both 5e and OSR formats provided in the appendices


Explore an ancient prison-tomb that has been partially flooded with lava. 5e & OSR rules systems supported.

A thousand years ago, this region was a savage frontier patrolled by a brutal order of warriors calling themselves the Knights of Dorwine. Led by a charismatic but deranged human known as Archpriest Teluthel, the order was both a blessing and a curse for the locals. The Knights were reliable when monsters came around, but they also demanded a high tax from those they helped. The knights took food, gold, and family heirlooms, anything of value to continue funding their order.

Saba Nocri was a shaman-necromancer of some local repute who had settled in the region years before Teluthel’s Knights arrived. She mostly kept to herself and tried to avoid conflict with the Knights. But Teluthel discovered that she was helping people from the surrounding villages with potions and healing magic. The Knights of Dorwine did not appreciate the competition, and Teluthel’s deranged mind came up with a twisted plan to punish her forever.

Teluthel would build the ultimate punishment, a prison-tomb for Saba Nocri and her followers that would be an inescapable torment. He spent years designing and building the Tomb of Immolation, and his obsession eventually destroyed the order. The Knights of Dorwine eventually completed the construction of the tomb, captured Saba Nocri and her followers and apprentices, and then sealed them inside and cursed the Tomb. The prison entrance was buried under rocks and dirt, records of its construction and existence expunged, and all knowledge faded into history when the Knights of Dorwine disbanded shortly after Teluthel’s death about a year later.

boardgame.name: Tomb of Immolation (TinyD6)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tomb of Immolation is a short but dense dungeon crawl with a variety of puzzles, traps, and role playing challenges to keep the players busy.


Designed for a party of five characters
The party should have a character with good disable device and lockpicking skills
New monsters described in the Bestiary
Three adventure hooks
Numerous new magic items described
Printer friendly maps and a set of six pre-generated player characters provided in the appendices


Explore an ancient prison-tomb that has been partially flooded with lava. TinyD6 and Tiny Dungeon 2e rules systems supported.

A thousand years ago, this region was a savage frontier patrolled by a brutal order of warriors calling themselves the Knights of Dorwine. Led by a charismatic but deranged human known as Archpriest Teluthel, the order was both a blessing and a curse for the locals. The Knights were reliable when monsters came around, but they also demanded a high tax from those they helped. The knights took food, gold, and family heirlooms, anything of value to continue funding their order.

Saba Nocri was a shaman-necromancer of some local repute who had settled in the region years before Teluthel’s Knights arrived. She mostly kept to herself and tried to avoid conflict with the Knights. But Teluthel discovered that she was helping people from the surrounding villages with potions and healing magic. The Knights of Dorwine did not appreciate the competition, and Teluthel’s deranged mind came up with a twisted plan to punish her forever.

Teluthel would build the ultimate punishment, a prison-tomb for Saba Nocri and her followers that would be an inescapable torment. He spent years designing and building the Tomb of Immolation, and his obsession eventually destroyed the order. The Knights of Dorwine eventually completed the construction of the tomb, captured Saba Nocri and her followers and apprentices, and then sealed them inside and cursed the Tomb. The prison entrance was buried under rocks and dirt, records of its construction and existence expunged, and all knowledge faded into history when the Knights of Dorwine disbanded shortly after Teluthel’s death about a year later.

boardgame.name: Erforsche den Körper
boardgame.description:
The box contains 2 cooperative games and a memory game that use an ingeniously simple scanning method to illuminate the human body. The "scanning device" is slid between a black background and one of 4 differently printed foils. The "scanning device" consists of a handle and a white square that brightly highlights parts of the foil. These highlighted parts are now to be associated with individual plates that show exactly the same parts.

The winner of the memory game is the person who collects the most tiles.

The other two cooperative games are won together when all the tiles have been distributed.

boardgame.name: Party Beach Creature Feature!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s a beautiful, sunny weekend on the beach. The kids are partying, the beer’s cold, and someone’s passing around what the locals call “jazz cigarettes.” Let’s be honest — life couldn’t be much better in this 1950s slice of American utopia. That is, until monstrous gill-kin emerge from the waves and assault our idyllic town, and shadowy science researchers conspire to stop the party!

You are the defenders of small-town America! And you are the only people who can drive the tide of invasion back into the sea!

They Came from Beneath the Sea! is a campy, action-filled, horrifying tabletop roleplaying game of 1950s science fiction, taking the best (and worst) bits from the B-movies of the era and presenting them as a thoroughly entertaining story. This jumpstart provides you with all the tools you need to start a story of They Came from Beneath the Sea! and tell many stories to follow.

They Came from Beneath the Sea! uses the Storypath System, provided in the pages of this book!

Party Beach Creature Feature includes:

Six playable characters — including an Everyman, a Survivor, a G-Man, a Mouth, and a Scientist.
A story split across three acts, perfect for a one-shot or convention play.
Creatures from the deep and villains from the land to throw at your players.
All the Cinematic powers, Quips, and Storypath System mechanics you need to run the game right from the page.
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Wondrous Tome of Wands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wondrous Tome of Wands provides more than 100 new magical wands for the world's greatest role-playing game. These magical items are carefully balanced and the book includes beautiful illustrations.

In addition to wands of every rarity level, The Wondrous Tome of Wands includes cursed artifacts and sentient wands with unique personalities that could turn your 5th Edition fantasy campaign upside down.

boardgame.name: The Fetid Revel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter the Feywild with this adventure for characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. The adventurers come across a satyr's revel deep in the forest, but all is not as it seems. Are your players prepared for glowing poisonous mushrooms, a satyr bard that dabbles in necromancy, and an undead minotaur with a nasty surprise?

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume III - Death in the Darkness)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume III contains the following:

MAGIC ITEM SET – Rumors speak about the Sanguis Lord's power, but the true strength is found when you've acquired all four pieces of this unique item set.
MAGICAL SPELLS – Creeping from the darkness, these eight spells are sure to haunt your adventures.
GM VARIANT RULE: UNDEAD TRAITS – Mundane skeletons and zombies are boring, so let's spice them up atouch! These variant rules will introduce some unique qualities to help keep your players on their toes.
GHOULISH BESTIARY – Fourteen new creaturesare ready to shamble into your campaign, including atemplate to create rot dragons from the corpses of fallenremains.
UNDEAD ENCOUNTER – A short undead encounter that can be dropped into any campaign, complete with a battlemap depicting a small settlement besieged by anundead army.

boardgame.name: Legendary Shamans: Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spirits of Power

Legendary Shamans is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements for Pathfinder Second Edition, this time focusing on the master channelers of the spirit world known as shamans. This new class is a versatile spellcaster that blends veneration of nature and the wild things that dwell therein with the myth and fantasy of animist shamanism. They bind themselves to the spirits of this world following the paths of animism, conduits, and mediums, with over 50 class feats to tailor their talents from Soulsight and Lucid Trance to Share Spirit and Manifest Ley Lines. You'll find over a dozen spirits to bind and wield their powers, including occult Ancestor, Akashic, and Dream spirits and primal Flame and Life spirits, and over 40 fantastic spells like project dream, twist fate, glorious plumage, and avatar of the deep!

boardgame.name: Amalfi: Renaissance
boardgame.description:
In Amalfi: Renaissance, players take on the role of merchants in the Italian port town of Amalfi during the Renaissance period. The town was a dominant maritime power during the last century, however its importance has diminished. The merchants of Amalfi are eager to recapture their previous success and revive the abandoned port town, but they only have 6 small ships.

Players trade resources using their ships and earn money and invest it in improving their infrastructure to help earn even more money!


By purchasing charts and investing in navigation, players can earn more money, more efficiently.
By building new ships, players can have more workers to take more actions.
By collecting paints, books and historical buildings, they receive honor and acclaim.
By hiring renowned historical figures who supports strategy, the players actions get stronger.
By creating counters in the cities who gives you more resources and new opportunities


Players work towards the goal of reviving Amalfi:Renaissance, while also becoming the most successful family in this historically significant harbor city. The game ends after 4 rounds. The player with the most Victory Points wins.

This new edition includes new rules (ow you can build counters), all new characters, the level design has been changed, and
the value of the cards has been updated.

boardgame.name: Art of Magic: Melee and Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The blast of a tactically placed spell, the expert strike of a masterful sword stroke, these are the domain of the magus. Masters of sword and spell, magi dominate combat with a powerful blend of magic and melee, bringing a panoply of options to warfare. Within you’ll find a variety of options across different cultures and traditions, adding a wealth of options to the magus class.

Unleash the Magus!
The magus class presents the perfect blend of combat-oriented features and spellcasting, appealing to the player who wants a variety of options and ways in which to take on their enemies. Just as class features and spell selection can lead to a wide variety of wizard builds, and choice and specializations in weapons, armor, and feats can result in drastically different types of fighters, so too are there countless ways to build a magus, blending magic and melee or ranged combat into very distinct fighting styles and character archetypes.

Inside, you’ll find a wealth of new character options, including archetypes, magus arcana, feats, and spells to bring your concept of the magus to life, and put a new twist on a favorite class.

boardgame.name: Westbound: Races
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Westbound is the encore offering from the makers of the Pure Steam Campaign Setting. This volume boasts new races to build your perfect Wild West character.

In future 5e Westbound releases, you can load out your characters with new steampunk equipment, feats, and vehicles. DMs can challenge players with new monsters, NPCs, and adventure hooks. Immerse yourself in the Ulleran West with new regions, settlements, and factions.

Westbound has everything you need to take your game into the wild unknown!

boardgame.name: La Cucaracha!: Wargames rules for engagements with small forces during the Mexican Revolution
boardgame.description:
Skirmish rules 20mm-54mm Plus scenarios, including what if's of foreign intervention.

(description from publisher)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: GMA1: Cult of The Rat God (1E/2E/3E/OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GMA1: Cult of The Rat God. The party arrives in the City of Genepa, a thriving port and trade town. While they explore the city and seek adventure, their inquiries lead them to a troll and reptile infested swamp in search of an elusive group of slavers that are reputed to be lead by a wererat bandit and his wife. The Rat King and The Rat Queen. White that is happening, a necromancer is busy, secretely plying his trade in or about the Ratmire District and the Planned Afterlife Cemetery. As undead start to rampage throught sections of the city each night, the council summons the players and other groups to investigate the cause of the discturbances. This leads the players down a perilous path of uncovering the Cult of The Rat God!

Love is eternal. The Rat King and The Rat Queen should know. Your search has led you here to their kingdom. Are you ready for a most perilous adventure? Herein is a terrible fortress, a haunted cemetery, a dank crypt, infested caves and a large territory for you to explore. A large overland map and encounter charts that are tailored to your travels await you within. Treacherous traps and agonizing death beckon to you expectantly. Will you succumb to The Curse of The Rat God? Here is a heroic adventure for character levels 3-7. This game module uses the 1st Edition RPG rules of the world's greatest role playing game as they appear in the OSR variant of those rules, OSRIC RPG. It is compatible and easily convertible to any OSR/Old School 1st Edition variant such as Old School Essentials, Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea, Sword & Sorcery or any other variant in the OSR. Armor Class in descending and ascending format, Thac0, Basic Attack Bonus are provided, making this module compatible with 1st edition, 2nd edition and 3/3.5 editions of the world's most famous role-playing game in most of its editions. A 5th Edition conversion is also in the works. What you won't find anywhere else is the epic quest contained herein!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Cepheus Deluxe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Starships riding fire across the sky. Heroes and villains exchanging laser fire. Desperate spacers struggling against an alien monstrosity. Vast planetary vistas, flying cities, moonscapes, mad robots, and first encounters. In short: high-action science-fiction adventure that stimulates your sense of wonder. Cepheus Deluxe puts you in the shoes of an adventurer visiting distant stars and encountering the unknown. Whether you are a seasoned player looking for a rules-light game, or a new gamer wanting to experience what science-fiction role-playing games are all about, Cepheus Deluxe opens your way forward.

Cepheus Deluxe is a set of rules for playing classic science fiction games. It includes rules on creating characters, resolving actions, fighting other creatures, and engaging in space battles, generating worlds, handling the risks of interstellar speculative trading, exploring new worlds, and many other activities. While designed for fast, action-packed play rather than an accurate simulation of reality, Cepheus Deluxe encompasses a wide variety of rules and materials for building a science-fiction universe and playing in it.

Cepheus Deluxe draws its inspiration from old-school science-fiction roleplaying games. It shares many similarities with these games. Material from older rules sets and those created with Cepheus Deluxe, the old Cepheus Light, the Cepheus Engine Core, and old-school sci-fi roleplaying games, are easily compatible with only a moderate amount of adjustment.

The future awaits!
